events.venue: Aotea College,Okowai Road, Okowai, New Zealand
events.long_description:
All Aboard - we're cruisin' - Show 1
Join us as we set sail on a spectacular time of dance - inspired by the sea, the ship and everything in-between

About this Event

Elite Dance Company welcomes you to our 2025 concert All Aboard.
Join us and meet all of the Elite Dance crew and officers that will take you on a journey that you will never forget. All of the crew are here to ensure you have a great time. Enjoy the food and sights this cruise has to offer including all of the amenities on the ship.
Whilst on board make sure you take the time to party, unwind and pamper yourself - keep an eye out for sea life and the magic of the ocean - you never know what you may see..

We have dancers aged from 1 to adult performing many genres of dance. All Aboard incorporates all dancers at Elite Dance Company. There are a few short breaks to stretch your legs throughout the show and to purchase sustinence from the foyer.

events.id: Welly Wonderland-Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Wakefield Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Welly Wonderland
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Wakefield Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
They’re back and bigger than ever. After sell-out shows at the Sydney Opera House, Signature Choir returns home, bringing their renowned Pasifika sound to a Christmas concert like no other. Performed with Wellington Brass Band, ‘Welly Wonderland’ blends Pasifika rhythms, soulful harmonies and bold brass in a reimagining of the traditional carols of Christmas.
At the Michael Fowler Centre for one night only—join us for an unforgettable celebration of culture, community, and the spirit of the season.

events.id: Sonic Delusion Smoooth Single Release Tour Greytown-73 Main Street, Greytown 5712, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Sonic Delusion Smoooth Single Release Tour Greytown
events.venue: 73 Main Street, Greytown 5712, New Zealand
events.long_description:
To mark the release of his brand-new single “Smoooth”, Sonic Delusion is hitting the road for a special six-date release tour. Known for his infectious grooves, playful looping, and feel-good folk-pop energy, Sonic Delusion brings audiences a mix of fresh tunes and crowd favourites — all wrapped in the joy and honesty that make his shows so irresistible.
Audiences can join the celebration at:
Saturday 15 November – Lakeside Playhouse, Opunake
Sunday 16 November – Wood St, Kakaramea
Thursday 4 December – Globe Theatre, Palmerston North
Friday 5 December – Firebird Cafe, Levin
Saturday 6 December – Hilltop House Concerts, Wellington
Sunday 7 December – Janette House Gig, Studio 73, Greytown
From Taranaki to the lower North Island, each stop promises to be a night of rhythm, laughter, and community. With “Smoooth” as the soundtrack, Sonic Delusion invites audiences to protest the madness of the world in the best way possible — by coming together, dancing, and choosing to live smoooth.

events.id: Sonic Delusion at Greytown Up Close & Personal-Studio 73, 73 Main Street, Greytown-Event Finder
events.name: Sonic Delusion at Greytown Up Close & Personal
events.venue: Studio 73, 73 Main Street, Greytown
events.long_description:
Too funky for folk and too folky for funk - that’s Sonic Delusion’s happy, funky & groovy indie pop.
In his boogielicious live performances, Sonic Delusion uses his well-worn loop pedal with an array of instruments to skillfully layer and create an irresistible sound that is bursting with more funk than folk can handle.

The vibrant Swiss-Kiwi, high-energy performer, Sonic Delusion (André Manella) has played over 1000 live shows at venues and festivals across Switzerland, New Zealand, Australia and Germany over the past 10 years.

“Sonic Delusion is funny, fresh and funky…a welcome breath of entertainment, joy, fun and smiles”
Graham Reid - Elsewhere.co.nz
“catchy melodic hooks that make you want to get up and dance”
Amy Maynard - NZ Musician Magazine

Buy tickets here or book by txt to 02102361951 and pay $25 cash only on the door.

Back where we belong at Studio 73.

Refreshments available for gold coin donation, including Scottish recipe Christmas cake (yes it does contain whisky)

events.id: Sunday Jazz - Ayrton Foote's 'Vote For Dizzy'-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
events.name: Sunday Jazz - Ayrton Foote's 'Vote For Dizzy'
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
The Rogue's regular Sunday afternoon jazz. Funky, jazzy, soulful jazz. Beer, hangs, and jazz, on a Sunday, perfect!

This week featuring local pianist Ayrton Foote with 'Vote For Dizzy'

In 1964 Dizzy Gillespie launched his bid to be the next president of the USA. Come join us as we pay tribute to the Jazz Trumpet legend, and ponder what the world could had of been like had he been elected.

Michael Taylor - Trumpet
Oscar Lavern - Sax
Ayrton Foote - Piano
Daniel Yeabsley - Bass
John Rae - Drums

Music from 5pm, FREE ENTRY - Koha for the band encouraged

Come join us as we pay tribute to the Jazz Trumpet legend, and ponder what the world could had of been like had he been elected.

events.id: Out in the Pool-6 Wanaka St, Johnsonville, Wellington 6037, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Out in the Pool
events.venue: 6 Wanaka St, Johnsonville, Wellington 6037, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Our Out in the Pool sessions are regular monthly sessions for all queer, transgender, gender diverse and non-binary folks
We invite the LGBTQI+ community and allies to dive in and swim in a safe and welcoming environment at Keith Spry Pool. These sessions are held on the first Sunday of every month and run 6pm-8pm.
Out in the Pool evenings at Keith Spry have:
Gender neutral changing rooms and bathrooms, as well as our Men's and Women's changing facilities.
Recreation lanes with inflatables, as well as the Dive board open (as staffing allows).
Lane space will be available to swim some lengths or aqua jog, and the teaching pool will be open as staffing allows.
Spa and Sauna available
Music, swimming and good vibes only.
There is no additional cost for these sessions, simply turn up and pay our regular pool entry fees. There is no need to register, just come on down!

events.id: SIRIOL JOYNER - Dance, Movement & Sound-13 Vennell St, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: SIRIOL JOYNER - Dance, Movement & Sound
events.venue: 13 Vennell St, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
SIRIOL JOYNER is an artist working within the field of dance and choreography.
She is obsessed with language: its relationship to dance and dancing and the material and political implications of this connection.
She creates movement, text, and object works focusing on notions of mutation, translation, and code-switching. Her interests are informed by her Welsh identity, her mother tongue Cymraeg and extend to the indigenous languages of Sweden and Sápmi where she currently lives. Her work has been presented at PSi, Aomori Japan; Museum of Contemporary Art, Puerto Rico; Movement Research NYC and in 2021 her solo piece ‘Listening to-’ was presented by Cullberg, the leading repertoire company for contemporary dance in Sweden.
On this, her first performance in Aotearoa, she will collaborate with local musicians in creating a rich and unique meeting of sound, music, and movement.
Featuring:
ERIKA GRANT
RICKY PREBBLE
ISAAC SMITH
WINTERWOOD
Sunday 7th December
Vogelmorn Hall
7:00pm doors7:30pm performance
$20.00
Bookings email: zwinterwood@gmail.com
Siriol visits Aotearoa with Support of the Swedish Arts Grants Committee.

events.id: DYING FETUS w/ 200 Stab Wounds-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: DYING FETUS w/ 200 Stab Wounds
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Armed with undeniably some of the heaviest riffs known to mankind, DYING FETUS has established a reputation for uncompromising integrity with a slew of classical bums and today rides a resurgence of respect and esteem with a new generation. The band continually refines its unique take on death, grind, and hardcore with a combination of virtuosity and ferocity, inescapably catchy hooks, punishing breakdowns and a complete lack of pretension.
After12 horribly long years since their last tour in Australia and in only their second appearance in New Zealand since 2009, DYING FETUS are well overdue to lash us unmercifully with their savage beatdowns and earth-moving grooves and grunt, equally designed to pulverize and mesmerize. 
On their first slog into the antipodes, Cleveland death metal legends-in-waiting 200 Stab Wounds serve up a brutal slab of old school death metal with a contemporary edge. Not for the faint-hearted, 200 Stab Wounds craft classic gore-themed savagery for themselves and like-minded brethren: thrill-seekers, carnage cravers, horror fans, and aficionados of the most extreme of metal.

events.long_description:
𝗗𝗬𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗙𝗘𝗧𝗨𝗦 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗴𝘂𝗲𝘀𝘁𝘀 𝟮𝟬𝟬 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗕 𝗪𝗢𝗨𝗡𝗗𝗦
𝗔𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗹𝗶𝗮𝗻 & 𝗡𝗲𝘄 𝗭𝗲𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗧𝗼𝘂𝗿, 𝗗𝗲𝗰 𝟱 – 𝟭𝟰, 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟱
DYING FETUS with 200 STAB WOUNDS performing at:
Dec 5th – Auckland, Galatos*
Dec 6th – Christchurch, Loons*
Dec 7th – Wellington, San Fran*
Dec 9th – Adelaide, Lion Arts Factory+
Dec 11th – Hobart, Altar+
Dec 12th – Melbourne, Northcote Theatre+
Dec 13th – Sydney, Metro Theatre+
Dec 14th – Brisbane, The Triffid+
*Organectomy appearing / +Ashen appearing
TICKETS ON SALE NOW at:
ADELAIDE, HOBART, MELBOURNE, BRISBANE – www.moshtix.com.au
SYDNEY – https://premier.ticketek.com.au
AUCKLAND – https://galatos.co.nz
CHRISTCHURCH – www.undertheradar.co.nz
WELLINGTON – https://moshtix.co.nz
Armed with undeniably some of the heaviest riffs known to mankind, 𝗗𝗬𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗙𝗘𝗧𝗨𝗦 has established a reputation for uncompromising integrity with a slew of classic albums and today rides a resurgence of respect and esteem with a new generation. The band continually refines its unique take on death, grind, and hardcore with a combination of virtuosity and ferocity, inescapably catchy hooks, punishing breakdowns and a complete lack of pretension.
After 12 horribly long years since their last tour in Australia and in only their second appearance in New Zealand since 2009, 𝗗𝗬𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗙𝗘𝗧𝗨𝗦 are well overdue to lash us unmercifully with their savage beatdowns and earth-moving grooves and grunt, equally designed to pulverize and mesmerize.
On their first slog into the antipodes, Cleveland death metal legends-in-waiting 𝟮𝟬𝟬 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗕 𝗪𝗢𝗨𝗡𝗗𝗦 serve up a brutal slab of old school death metal with a contemporary edge. Not for the faint-hearted, 𝟮𝟬𝟬 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗕 𝗪𝗢𝗨𝗡𝗗𝗦 craft classic gore-themed savagery for themselves and like-minded brethren: thrill-seekers, carnage cravers, horror fans, and aficionados of the most extreme of metal.
Warming up the circle pits and necks will be the slamming sonic signature of ORGANECTOMY in New Zealand and the old-school death metal grit and punishing ferocity of ASHEN in Australia.
www.facebook.com/DyingFetus

www.facebook.com/200StabWounds

www.facebook.com/organectomynz

www.facebook.com/ashendeath

https://swdpresents.com

events.id: Wellington Theatre Awards 2025-12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Wellington Theatre Awards 2025
events.venue: 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Celebrate the theatrical wrap-up of the season, The Wellington Theatre Awards, Ngā Whakarākei O Whātaitai 2025, at the Hannah Playhouse.
From reimagined classical texts to politically charged reflections on Aotearoa, New Zealand, the Wellington Theatre Awards recognise the innovation, creativity and excellence of our live theatre sector and the hundreds of shows produced and performed in Te Whanganui a Tara over the last year. Indulge in art, connect, reminisce, and laugh the night away at this special evening honouring the writers, designers, actors, directors, technicians and audiences that make theatre in this city possible.
Without the support of our wonderful sponsors and funders the 2025 Ngā Whakarākei O Whātaitai - Wellington Theatre Awards wouldn’t be possible. Thank you Wellington City Council, Grouse Lighting, HardKase Audio, The Woodbury Family, Suzanne Snively & Ian Fraser, Adam Foundation and to our wonderful theatre cluster - Playmarket, Tākina, Taki Rua Productions, BATS Theatre, Circa Theatre, NZ Fringe, Barbarian Productions, Aotearoa NZ Festival, Te Auaha, Tahi Festival, PAYPA and Hannah Playhouse!

events.name: Wellington Theatre Awards 2025
events.venue: 12 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description:
…and we’re back, at The Hannah!
Tickets are now available for The Wellington Theatre Awards Ngā Whakarākei o Whātaitai 2025 taking place on Sunday 7 December.
A celebration of our city's independent actors, designers, writers, composers, directors and technical talent. The 33rd annual awards will be presented on stage at The Hannah during the season of The Man Whose Mother Was a Pirate. Yupp, these prestigious awards are set to be on a pirate ship.
So all aboard for the biggest party of the year!
We look forward to a night where our wide-reaching freelance industry comes together to celebrate each other and all that we achieved in 2025.
Secure your ticket today: https://shorturl.at/PC71y
Nominees to be announced shortly.

events.id: Thorndon Fair 2025-Tinakori Rd and Hill Street, New Zealand 6011,241 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Thorndon Fair 2025
events.venue: Tinakori Rd and Hill Street, New Zealand 6011,241 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Thorndon Fair 2025
Wellington’s iconic street fair is back!

Since 1977, the Thorndon Fair has been a highlight of the capital’s summer calendar — and in 2025, we’re bringing the energy, creativity and community spirit back to the streets of Thorndon.

With over 250 stallholders from across Aotearoa, this is your chance to discover:
🖼️ Unique art and crafts
🍴 Delicious food and drink
👚 Fashion, accessories and lifestyle products
📚 Books, gifts, toys, and treats for pets
🌿 Outdoor and experience products
🎶 Live music and entertainment all day

Whether you're shopping, looking for a fun day out with the whānau, or just love a good local market — there’s something for everyone.

Around 40% of our stallholders travel 100km or more to be here, so many of the products you’ll find are unique to Wellington on the day.

🎈 Follow our page for sneak peeks, giveaways, and stallholder showcases as we count down to the big day.
📲 Click "Going" and invite your friends — let's make this our biggest fair yet!

Also check out other Music events in Wellington, Arts events in Wellington.

events.id: Te Wiki Whakanui, Celebration Week-4 Queens Whrf, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Te Wiki Whakanui, Celebration Week
events.venue: 4 Queens Whrf, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We’re celebrating an amazing 11 years at 4 Queens Wharf before our big move to Te Matapihi ki te Ao Nui, Central Library.
Join us in our play space for special activities each day during our last week (Monday 8 December - Friday 12 December):
The Great Kiwi Scavenger Hunt | Every day
Collect an activity sheet from the front desk and begin your adventure through the forest. Hand in your completed sheet for a reward.
Memories box | Every day
At the craft table, draw or write your special memories of our play space that you’d like to share with our PlayHQ whānau.
Parachute | Every day
Our parachute will be out in PlayHQ all day every day for rainbow fun, let one of our kaitiaki know if you want to play.
Tamariki yoga | Monday 8 December
Join Aria for tamariki yoga, stretching and movement at 11.00am-11.30am
Storytime | Tuesday 9 December
Gather around for storytime at 11.00am-11.30am, where we'll read some favourite stories together.
Waiata Māori and poi | Wednesday 10 December
Bring your singing voice to PlayHQ for waiata Māori at 11.00am-11.30am. Pick up a poi and try out simple movements as we all sing along.
Crafts | Thursday 11 December
Join us at the craft table 11.00am-11.30am and make a PlayHQ souvenir to take home.
Hākari, kōrero and photos | Friday 12 December
For our last ever day at Queens Wharf, bring in your favourite soft toy for a PlayHQ friends hākari. Bring your own lunch and help yourself to free fresh fruit (please remember PlayHQ is a nut free zone – please do not bring in items with peanuts or tree nuts).
Free photos! Our photobooth will be free all day on Friday so you can take a last photo at Ngā Tūrua Kiwi.
As a last day treat, we’ll have goodie bags for the first 50 tamariki to visit on our final day (Friday).

events.id: Read to Kurī-34 Moorefield Rd, Johnsonville, Wellington 6037, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Read to Kurī
events.venue: 34 Moorefield Rd, Johnsonville, Wellington 6037, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us and our doggy guests from Canine Friends Pet Therapy for Read to Kurī at the library. You can book a 15-minute session to sit with one of our friendly dogs and read your favourite book, or one you've found at the library.
Read to Kurī aims to help children improve their literacy, self-confidence, and self-esteem in a relaxed, non-judgemental environment. This programme is perfect for tamariki aged 5+ who would like to practice their reading skills while making a new canine friend at the library.
To book your session, please call the library on 04 477 6151, or email johnsonville.library@wcc.govt.nz with your preferred date and time.
Bookings are for 15 minutes only. After you have booked, library staff will be in contact informing you what time to arrive for your session.

events.id: Unspoken Rules of Japan-100 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Unspoken Rules of Japan
events.venue: 100 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Are you planning to visit, study, or work in Japan? Worried about Japan’s unspoken rules? Let’s clear them up together!
All attendees must register at https://forms.office.com/r/edXwdDsAhX
Register online to join us for a fun and interactive session with JETAA and MEXT Alumni as we uncover the unspoken social rules that shape daily life in Japan from how to behave on a train to what not to do in a supermarket!
In this relaxed, Q&A-style event, we’ll share funny and insightful stories about real-life etiquette in Japan:
Whether you’re a soon-to-be traveller, a university student preparing for exchange, or a future JET participant, this event will give you the insider knowledge (and a few laughs) to make your time in Japan smooth and enjoyable.
Date & Time: December 8th (Monday) 5:30pm to 6:30pm
Venue: L18, The Majestic Centre, JICC, 100 Willis St. Wellington
Format: Talk + Open Q&A
Language: English
Audience: NZ university students, Japan-bound travellers, and anyone curious about Japanese culture
Admission: Free (registration required)

events.id: Welly On Wheels - City to Island Bay: Confidence & Skills for Biking-Boatshed Apartments, 22 Herd St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Welly On Wheels - City to Island Bay: Confidence & Skills for Biking
events.venue: Boatshed Apartments, 22 Herd St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We're joining up with Pedal Ready for a guided bike tour along the cycle route from central Wellington to Island Bay.
Build your confidence and skills to ride safely and efficiently by paihikara (bike), explore the latest cycleway improvements, and learn practical tips for night-time commuting.
The ride starts and finishes at Switched On Bikes HQ near Waitangi Park, heading to Shorland Park in Island Bay. You are welcome to finish the ride at Shorland Park or ride back to Waitangi Park. Note: the event may be postponed in the case of adverse weather.
Monday 8 December
5.30pm - 7.30pm (arrive 30 minutes early if renting a bike)
Meet at Switched on Bikes HQ, near Waitangi Park
Free event. E-bike hire available for $10.
These rides are suitable for people who:
Know how to ride a bike but aren't yet travelling by bike in the city; or
Those travelling by bike in the city but would like to gain confidence; or
Those who want to learn how to use new infrastructure.
Open to riders aged 18+ (or 13+ if accompanied by an adult). Families are also welcome to bring younger children on cargo bikes or bike seats provided themselves. Please enquire directly with Switched on Bikes if you'd like to borrow a bike seat for the tour.
Spaces are limited, so make sure to register here: https://www.eventfinda.co.nz/.../welly-on.../wellington

E-bike hire available for $10.

events.id: Welly On Wheels - City to Island Bay: Confidence & Skills for Biking-Switched on Bikes, Wellington Waterfront 15/22 Herd Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Welly On Wheels - City to Island Bay: Confidence & Skills for Biking
events.venue: Switched on Bikes, Wellington Waterfront 15/22 Herd Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join Wellington City Council, Pedal Ready, and Switched On Bikes for a guided bike tour along the cycle route from central Wellington to Island Bay. Build your confidence and skills to ride safely and efficiently by paihikara (bike), explore the latest cycleway improvements, and learn practical tips for night-time commuting.

The ride starts and finishes at Switched On Bikes HQ near Waitangi Park, heading to Shorland Park in Island Bay. You are welcome to finish the ride at Shorland Park or ride back to Waitangi Park. Note: the event may be postponed in the case of adverse weather.

Duration: Please allow around 2 hours for the ride.
Arrival: Arrive 30 minutes early if you’re renting a bike.
Preparation: Bring clothing suitable for changing weather conditions.

These rides are ideal for people who:
- Can ride a bike but haven’t yet started biking regularly in the city.
- Already ride in the city but want to gain confidence.
- Want to learn how to use Wellington’s cycleway network safely and efficiently.

Who can join: Open to riders aged 18+, or 13+ if accompanied by an adult. Younger children are welcome on cargo bikes or bike seats provided by participants. If you’d like to borrow a bike seat, please contact Switched On Bikes directly.

Bikes and bookings:
An electric bike is strongly recommended. Thanks to Switched On Bikes and Wellington City Council, you can rent one for only $10 if you don’t have access to your own. Please book your e-bike separately here: https://switchedonbikes.rezdy.com/642002/electric-bike-hire-welly-on-wheels

After the tour, you can either leave your bike with us and catch a bus back to the city or keep riding if you’re feeling energetic! You’re welcome to return the bike before 9am the next day at no extra cost or hold onto it for the following day at a discounted rate of $39.

If you’d like to learn to ride a bike away from traffic, check out the free Pedal Ready courses on their website.

For any pātai (questions) about the tours, please email info@pedalready.org.nz.

Privacy Statement:
Information collected for this ride is used for booking and safety purposes. Your name and emergency contact details will be deleted within 14 days after the tour. Other provided information may be stored anonymously to support project evaluation. Your email address will be kept for up to 4 months so we can share follow-up information about biking in Pōneke and invite you to give feedback about your experience.

You have the right to request access to or correction of your information. To do so, please email tours@wcc.govt.nz.
events.description:
Join Wellington City Council, Pedal Ready, and Switched On Bikes for a guided bike tour along the cycle route from central Wellington to Island Bay.
You are welcome to finish the ride at Shorland Park or ride back to Waitangi Park.
If you’d like to borrow a bike seat, please contact Switched On Bikes directly.
Please book your e-bike separately here: https://switchedonbikes.rezdy.com/642002/electric-bike-hire-welly-on-wheels After the tour, you can either leave your bike with us and catch a bus back to the city or keep riding if you’re feeling energetic!
Your email address will be kept for up to 4 months so we can share follow-up information about biking in Pōneke and invite you to give feedback about your experience.

events.id: Yoga in the Park-Waikanae Park, Park Ave, Waikanae-Event Finder
events.name: Yoga in the Park
events.venue: Waikanae Park, Park Ave, Waikanae
events.long_description:
Join us for the 7th year of Yoga in the Park at Waikanae Park on Park Ave!

Our classes focus on balance and stability, incorporating breathing exercises, longer holds, and plenty of options to modify poses based on your fitness level. We’ve had kids join us in past years, and if you consider yourself "older," you’re more than welcome, too. This is your practice, so if you’d rather spend the hour in Child’s Pose, soaking in the sounds of the birds, that’s perfectly fine!

What to bring: A mat or towel, a hat, and some water. I’ll take care of the rest.

Payment Options:
Cash
Bank transfer (online)

Pricing:
$15 for a single class
$150 for an Outdoor Pass (covers the whole season: Nov to March, 21 classes + additional beach yoga sessions starting in 2026)

I can’t wait to see familiar faces and welcome new ones this season! Feel free to get in touch if you have any questions.

events.name: Paint and Wine Night in Tawa, Wellington - Piha Sunset
events.venue: The Borough, 162/168 Main Road, Tawa, Wellington
events.long_description:
The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Tawa, Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

events.id: 9th December | Mental Health First Response Training - 1 Day-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: 9th December | Mental Health First Response Training - 1 Day
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Book now at hello@coliberate.co.nz
Do you feel equipped to respond to someone in the moment they are in distress?
Mental Health First Response is a 1 day training that delivers key understandings, skills and practices so people can provide first response and co-care support for your wider community or workplace. This succinct and robust training enables them to respond quickly and effectively.

"All New Zealanders would hugely benefit from this training. No one is immune to mental illness and this training allows us to be better equipped to deal with it early and effectively. At the most basic level, this course teaches us how to better communicate with each other, something we have lost and something that has the power to be lifesaving. The skills learned through this course are priceless and much needed by everyone in every walk of life." Jessica Jane Harnett, MHFR Course Participant.
---
This one day course is made up of four modulesL:
1. Mental Health Support Platforms - this session creates a strong foundation for all understandings of best support practices.
2. CRISIS Response - this session develops confidence to respond to mental health crises.
3. CONVOS Support Framework - this session guides you through a conversational framework to help you provide mental health support early.
4. Practice - build confidence by practicing the skills and applying it to your context in this session.


All sessions have:
∙ Participatory learning approach
∙ Individual workbooks
∙ Visual, game-based and participant-led learning environment
∙ CoLiberate’s acclaimed group experience model
--> Certificate valid for 1 year on completion.
----
Keen to do this training but these dates don't work for you? Please fill out our Expression of Interest form and we will be in touch with future training dates. https://tinyurl.com/fuy55y6n

Please don't hesitate to get in touch if you have any questions about this training at hello@coliberate.co.nz

events.id: Throwing Muses - Wellington, New Zealand-San Fran,171 Cuba Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Throwing Muses - Wellington, New Zealand
events.venue: San Fran,171 Cuba Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Throwing Muses - Wellington, New Zealand
Throwing Muses - one of the most acclaimed and beloved US indie bands - will perform two New Zealand shows in December.

The band's first NZ tour in 31 years features concerts at San Fran, Wellington on 9 December, and Double Whammy in Auckland on 10 December.

Formed by Kristin Hersh with high school friends, the band pioneered a new alternative sound, releasing a string of critically celebrated albums and touring the world.

Throwing Muses - featuring Kristin Hersh, David Narcizo and Bernard Georges - recently released new album ‘Moonlight Concessions’ which has been described by Pitchfork Magazine as: “A stunning return to form”.

Don't miss Throwing Muses performing their career-spanning concerts in Auckland and Wellington in December.

events.id: TED-Style Talks (9 Dec) — Quiz night + pot luck 🥘🎉-Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: TED-Style Talks (9 Dec) — Quiz night + pot luck 🥘🎉
events.venue: Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
✨ Join us in celebrating another year of educational, inspirational, and entertaining TED-Style Tuesday Talks with a quiz night and pot luck ✨

Get your pay-what-you-feel ticket 🎟 and don't forget to bring along some food to share and some curiosity 🧐
Plan
5:15pm - Doors open, registration, and mingle
5:40pm - Intro and welcome
5:45pm - Quiz begins
6:30pm - Pot luck and catch up
7:15pm - Karaoke (optional)
Tea will be available at the venue and a cash bar will be operating. Bring a plate to share with everyone 😋
How to find us: Take the "high rise lifts" in Majestic Centre to level 28. We'll also put up signs at the lift. Building entrance is from Willis Street (till 6pm) and from Boulcott Street (till 7pm).
We take pictures to document the events. If you don't want to be photographed, simply let us know on arrival.
You may also click "follow" on Humanitix to be notified of future events.
See you on the 9th!
---
About the group
We are a group of curious people from all walks of life who want to learn and get inspired from each other. Everyone is welcome to join, as long as you are curious and willing to share and learn.

events.id: Hypnosis for a Manifestation Mastermind-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Hypnosis for a Manifestation Mastermind
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars

This workshop invites you to explore the deeper roots of abundance, beyond effort, beyond control. Together, we’ll look at how inner clarity, energetic alignment, and conscious detachment open the flow of true prosperity.

Instead of chasing outcomes, you’ll learn to move with life, to act from purpose rather than pressure. We’ll reflect on how attention shapes reality, why stillness restores vitality, and how joy itself becomes a magnet for success.

This experience isn’t about manifesting more things, it’s about aligning with the movement of life, where fulfillment, freedom, and natural abundance unfold with ease.

Meet Gopi, your host

Gopi helps spiritually minded professionals achieve clarity and overcome challenges on their path through his unique integration of hypnotherapy and palmistry. During his former life as a monk, he delved into the timeless wisdom of astrology, palmistry, and the ancient knowledge of the mind and consciousness, gaining deep insights into human psychology. He combines these powerful teachings with modern, effective tools as a certified practitioner in applied hypnotherapy, along with the knowledge he gained through his diploma in psychology and counseling.

6.15pm Tuesday 9th December

End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.

events.id: Men's Group Tuesday 9 Dec-Central City, Wellington, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Men's Group Tuesday 9 Dec
events.venue: Central City, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

Join the event waitlist if meetings are full - a space often comes up!

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple and proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

events.name: 9 December Whisky Tasting
events.venue: 16 Dundas Street, Seatoun, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Whisky Tasting: 9 December 2025
Hosted by Matt Mueller
On Tuesday, December 8th, the Seatoun Clubhouse will host our annual "Christmas Whisky Tasting" where every sample of "whisky" is an unexpected holiday treat!
What should you expect?  A blend!  Whiskies from countries other than Scotland. A whisky that costs more than $300 per bottle! A whisky that we've tried before (kinda), and some twists and turns along the way. This tasting will be served up completely blind, where the bottles are hidden, and whatever is in the glass must speak for itself.  It WILL be interesting.
Please join me for a lively end-of-year tasting on Tuesday, December 8th at the Seatoun Clubhouse.  Tickets are $60 per person.
See you then,
Matt
*** Please note you need to be a member or a guest of a member to attend. Details on how to pay subs is below***
Membership subscriptions
Subs details: $50 for social membership, $100 for family social, $120 for playing membership. Pay direct into the club bank account:
Account Name: Seatoun Bowling Club Inc  
Bank: Westpac Kilbirnie  
Bank Account #: 030521- 0101368 - 00 
Please include your name in one of the boxes on the bank payment form.

events.id: Dark Matter-1 Kent Ter, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Dark Matter
events.venue: 1 Kent Ter, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Written and Directed by Chris Robertson. Produced by Aimee Dredge
A crew of six journey millions of miles away to the planet of Obiteria, in search of the unknown.
However, at the halfway point on their mission, they stumble upon something that could change their lives forever.
The disjointed group has to face the biggest decision of their life. Should they keep what they found a secret, or let everyone home on Earth know the truth? Terminal illness, and religion are the driving factors for opposing views, but what secrets will be revealed about the rest of the unlikely astronauts.
With only a day before they descend home, a choice has to be made. And it has to be now!
After a successful Playreading in 2024, ‘Dark Matter’ now is ready for the stage.
CREATIVE TEAM
AADredge presents a new play written and directed by Chris Robertson.
Our Crewmen:
Kit Marsh as Alice "the scientist"
James Bayliss as Liam "the captain"
Maea Shepherd as Eva "the doctor"
Kealan Schmidt as Peter "the pilot"
Legion Kelly as Adam "the sergeant"
Georgia Woodrow as Liz "the engineer"
Tech by Sophie Badrick

events.id: Throwing Muses-San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Throwing Muses
events.venue: San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Throwing Muses - one of the most acclaimed US college bands of the 1990s - will perform two New Zealand shows in December.


The band has announced concerts at San Fran, Wellington on 9 December, and Double Whammy in Auckland on 10 December.
Throwing Muses' Aotearoa tour is part of New Zealand promoter Plus1 Touring's 25th anniversary celebrations.
These are Throwing Muses' first shows in New Zealand since 1994.
Formed by Kristin Hersh with high school friends, the band pioneered a new alternative sound, releasing a string of critically celebrated albums and touring the world.
Throwing Muses - featuring Kristin Hersh, David Narcizo and Bernard Georges - recently released new album ‘Moonlight Concessions’ which has been described by Pitchfork Magazine as: “A stunning return to form”.
‘Moonlight Concessions’ goes back to basics, a return for Throwing Muses to their esoteric off-kilter best courtesy of Kristin’s pin-sharp sketches and their suitably abrasive musical arrangements. The album follows ‘Sun Racket’ from 2020, a heady set filled with tough and tender tales spiked with surreal imagery.
Don't miss Throwing Muses performing their career-spanning concerts in Auckland and Wellington in December.

events.long_description:
Newtown Seeds to Feeds Hui 3
🌱 Newtown Seeds to Feeds: Planting, Potluck, and Community Cheer! 🥗

Nau mai, haere mai! Join the Seeds to Feeds Newtown Crew for a joyful evening of hands-on gardening, shared kai, and connecting with your neighbours.

Whether you're a seasoned green thumb, a complete beginner, or just someone who loves good food and great company, this is the perfect opportunity to get involved in our local food journey!

What's Happening?

Hands-on Planting: We'll be rolling up our sleeves to get some beautiful summer seedlings into the ground at the Mornington Golf Club. It's a fantastic chance to learn a new skill or share your existing knowledge.

Delicious Pot Luck: Bring a plate of your favourite food to share!

Community Connection: Meet the passionate people growing, cooking and sharing kai right here in our community.

Event Details
📅 Date: Sunday, 10th December

⏰ Time: From 4:00 PM

📍 Location: Mornington Golf Club

Everyone is welcome! Come and see what all the fuss is about. We can't wait to meet you!

Arohanui! The Seeds to Feeds Newtown Crew

events.venue: St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description: Join us for this annual and joyous event - carol singing with the Resonance Choir, led by Simon Christie. Resonance is an all-comers choir formed in 2007 by a group of parents from Kelburn Normal School. The choir has grown to around 60 members and is now based in Karori. It includes members from across Wellington. Our aim is to enjoy singing and have fun. Resonance sings a wide range of repertoire in SATB which includes classical, choral, popular and world music. Our St Andrew’s concert will include much loved and popular Christmas Carols to kick the festive season off! Audience participation is welcome!

events.id: Chinese footprints: A walking tour of Chinese Wellington history-126 Vivian Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Chinese footprints: A walking tour of Chinese Wellington history
events.venue: 126 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join Oral History Advisor Lynette Shum on a walking tour exploring the rich history of the Chinese in Wellington. The tour will also draw on images, ephemera, and oral history from the collections of the Alexander Turnbull Library.
Sites of significance for early Chinese communities
Chinese footprints, led by Lynette Shum (Oral History Advisor, National Library New Zealand), will take attendees on a walking tour exploring the rich history of the Chinese in Wellington.
This two-hour tour highlights sites of significance for Wellington’s early Chinese community, including businesses, eateries, and Haining Street’s ‘Chinatown’. Much of this has been erased and is now largely invisible to passers-by. The tour will also draw on images, ephemera, and oral history from the Alexander Turnbull Library's collections.
The tour starts at the Wellington Trades’ Hall Building (124-128 Vivian Street) with a brief introduction, and concludes there with a pot of Chinese tea.
A koha of $10 is suggested to help cover the cost of running the tours.
*** RSVP now for your spot — Spots are limited, so book your place now by emailing ATLOutreach@dia.govt.nz ***
About the speakers
Lynette Shum, third-generation Poon Yue Chinese New Zealander, is Oral History Advisor for the National Library of New Zealand. Her first home was on the fringes of Chinatown, yet she was unaware of its existence until researching what would become the Haining Street Oral History Project. She has completed an MA on the topic.
Image: Poon Fah Association, Wellington. Photo by Lynette Shum.

events.name: Christmas at Katherine Mansfield House & Garden
events.venue: Katherine Mansfield House & Garden, 25 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington
events.long_description:
Get into the festive spirit with a guided tour of Katherine Mansfield House & Garden that highlights Victorian Christmas traditions and Katherine Mansfield’s own love of Christmas.

The tour will be followed by a performance of some Christmas favourites by members of the Wellington City Chorus while you enjoy a glass of Hunter’s Wines MiruMiru (or a non-alcoholic option) and nibbles. Our small but carefully curated gift shop might also provide some gift inspiration!

“I hope you have a happy Christmas and Joy in the New Year, real, real Joy.” – Katherine Mansfield in a letter to Dorothy Brett, 1919

Katherine Mansfield House & Garden is a Category I Historic Place that celebrates the life and work of internationally acclaimed writer Katherine Mansfield, born at the house in 1888. Please note that the guided tour will journey through the whole house, which includes stairs. For more information, please see the Accessibility page of our website.

events.venue: Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
FutureNow Presents
DJ NOIZ
KENNYON BROWN
DONELL LEWIS
Live in Wellington
Wednesday 10 December 2025
San Fran
Supported by
J.Tajor
A.R.T
This December, DJ Noiz, Kennyon Brown and Donell Lewis bring their signature island sound for a long-awaited New Zealand tour, hitting Wellington, Rotorua, Auckland and Hamilton. Known for hit records 'Senorita', 'Chill', 'Amelia', 'Island Girl' and more, the trio have become global ambassadors of modern Pacific R&B — blending smooth vocals, island grooves and soulful production that’s earned them millions of streams and loyal fans worldwide.
Joining them on the road is special guest and viral superstar J.Tajor known for his hit record ‘Like I Do’. Together, they promise an unforgettable celebration of Pacific music, culture and connection — a summer tour that captures the soul of the islands.
Buy tickets via futurenowmusic.com
Doors 7pm • 18+ Only • ID Required
171 Cuba Street, Wellington 6011

events.id: Distilled Comedy-The Bond Store, 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Distilled Comedy
events.venue: The Bond Store, 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Distilled Comedy at The Bond Store, the home of "The Jar" is back for October.

12 comedians from far and wide will be putting their name in the jar and you, the audience, will get to pick at random who is up next.

5 minutes of hilarity will follow and then it's back to the jar to find out who is next.

A 10 minute ask the comedians anything will round the night off ... will it be a cacophony of laughter or a car crash ... that's the fun.

So grab your mates, buy your tickets and book a table. Come early for some great food and cocktails.

events.id: Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Beneath the Blue-131 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Beneath the Blue
events.venue: 131 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!
Join us for a creative evening of drinking
and painting
in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!
Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.
Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.
What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!
We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.
For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to
[[https://paintvine.co.nz/]

events.id: WellyForge#6, 10th Dec 2025 (Christmas Edition)-118 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: WellyForge#6, 10th Dec 2025 (Christmas Edition)
events.venue: 118 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us to help progress Wellington by bringing together science, tech & investors from across the city into an informal, fun and informative meet-up. The goal of the event is that you learn something new, meet someone new, have fun and we all start forging new paths ahead for Wellington.
Focus of the night is the KiwiNet award winners who are from Wellington. KiwiNet funds the commercialization of public research across 19 universities in NZ. So, your show will be:
1st Speaker: Dr Ben Mallett from the MacDiarmid and Robinson Research Institute (part of Victoria) who won the Breakthrough Innovator Award, and is a co-founder of JxB Space Systems.
Quickfire Speakers:
Maci Libby, Massey Design Graduate, founder of Wise Gear NZ, passionate about outdoor adventure
Suse Reynolds, KiwiNet Commercialization Icon Award Winner, and big start-up fan (investor & Director)
Lachlan Mead, Young Enterprise Scheme Award Winner, and founder of the Christmas Chaos card-game, yes, copies will be available!
2nd Speakers: Prof Rob Weinkove who leads the Malaghan Institute's CAR-T cell program which won the KiwiNet PwC Breakthrough Project Award, and John Robson CEO of BioOra, a spin-out from the Malaghan which recently raised $15m to accelerate roll-out of its cancer treatment.
The venue is bohemian bookstore, Undercurrent, a perfect venue for story telling but tickets are limited - so please reserve yours, but if you do end up not being able to come please return the ticket!
Join WellyForge

KiwiNet funds the commercialization of public research across 19 universities in NZ.

events.name: The Greatest Christmas Show
events.venue: Southward Theatre, Otaihanga Rd, Otaihanga, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
The Greatest Christmas Show is New Zealand’s #1 family Christmas event, blending heartwarming moments, spectacular magic, and world-class entertainment into one unforgettable night.
Led by acclaimed vocalists Cat Hay and Sasha Simic, prepare for a breathtaking night of music, dance and cirque that will leave you wondering if Christmas magic might just be real.
Soaring vocals will fill the theatre with the spirit of Christmas, while our cast of incredible dancers and a jaw-dropping cirque act bring the stage to life in a flurry of wonder, skill, and glittering costumes.

From high-flying feats to touching moments that capture the true meaning of Christmas, and a very special visit from Santa Claus himself, this is a show that will warm hearts, inspire smiles, and create cherished memories for the whole family.

events.venue: Papakowhai School,17 Spey Pl, Papakowhai, Porirua 5024, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
Papakowhai School End of Year BBQ
NEW DATE DUE TO WEATHER: 11 Dec. All scheduled timings will remain the same except for the performances – unfortunately these will not be taking place on this new date. We have re-opened Kindo so you can pre-purchase food for those that can now come on 11th. Pre-orders now close at midnight on 9 Dec. All current orders through Kindo will be honoured on the new BBQ date.

Our annual end-of-year celebration is even bigger and better this year. Join us for an evening of food, fun, and entertainment.

From 5pm we have a visit from members of the Women's Phoenix and the Magilla from Wellington Saints is bringing along the NBL Trophy to show off - join them for a meet and greet and games on the turf.

Get involved in the feature event - adults v kids TUG OF WAR!

Head into the hall for performances from school groups, including Kapa Haka and Rimu Art Splash!

Bring cash to grab raffle tickets and be in with a chance to win one of three amazing prize packs from awesome local businesses.

Volunteer to help out and ensure this incredible event is enjoyable for everyone**

Entertainment includes:
Meet & Greet zone (5.00-5.20pm)
Womens Phoenix Players
Wellington Saints Trophy & Mascot
Play zone (5.20-5.45pm)
Womens Phoenix Players & kids on the turf
Tug of War (5.50pm)
Adults v kids
Performances in the Hall (6.10-6.50pm)
Kapa Haka, Rimu Art Splash, plus more
Raffle draws (6.55pm)
Finish at 7pm.


*NB: Food orders - pre-purchasing is designed to help limit waste and expense for the committee, as well as to limit wait times on the night. Please understand there has been a price increase as we do not have the same (incredible) level of sponsorship that we've had in previous years.

**NB: Volunteers power this event - it simply cannot happen without help from the school community. The more people who help out, the less mahi for everyone. Please consider adding a volunteer shift when placing pre-orders.

events.id: Young Photographer Award 2025-2 Queens Drive, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Young Photographer Award 2025
events.venue: 2 Queens Drive, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us for an evening of inspiration, creativity and photography
Join us for the inaugural Young Photographer Award, the first event of its kind in New Zealand celebrating young creative talent aged 7 to 18.
Over the past year we have run more than 80 workshops and inspired over 180 kids to try photography. Many arrived with no previous experience and discovered a new way to express themselves. Some even chose photography as their future career. Our workshops are fully inclusive and also support kids who may need extra learning help, giving them a space to slow down, focus and build confidence through creativity.
Held in Lower Hutt, Wellington, this evening is all about creativity, wonder and community. Students who took part in our photography workshops will have their work displayed at the event, and our nominated young photographers will receive special awards recognising their talent, effort and unique way of seeing the world.
A creative evening for everyone
The event will be inspiring not only for young photographers but also for adults, families and anyone who loves creativity and photography. It is a great chance to support young talent, enjoy beautiful images and be part of a welcoming creative community.
Bring your friends and whānau. The more support we show our young photographers, the more their creativity shines and inspires others.
Guest speakers
We are excited to welcome two inspiring speakers:
Tushar Sharma

Landscape and nature photographer, conservationist and founder of IMAGEn8, an Auckland-based charity offering photography workshops for kids. Tushar’s work focuses on connecting young people with the natural world through the lens.
Chris McKeown

Chris is a Wellington photographer whose images have been nominated for multiple awards and published widely. His work appears in calendars, fine art prints, canvases and magazines. His photos are also licensed for annual reports, websites, branding, headshots and large public-space murals. Chris photographs events, family gatherings, performances, sporting events and weddings, bringing a warm and thoughtful approach to every project.

events.venue: 2 Queens Drive, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
On 11 December I invite you to join us for the first ever Young Photographer Award 2025 in Aotearoa! It will take place right here in Wellington, in Lower Hutt.
The event is free and you can RSVP here ->
https://events.humanitix.com/young-photographer-award-2025
At The Art of Seeing Academy we run photography workshops for kids aged 7 to 18 with our wonderful tutors and volunteers. Since 2023 we have run more than 80 workshops across weekends, schools, homeschool groups, after school sessions and private groups. More than 180 kids have joined us and many now see photography as part of their everyday life!
We could not be prouder of their creativity, effort and talent. This awards night is our way of honouring them and creating a moment they will remember. We will also have fantastic speakers sharing their journeys, careers and inspiration in photography.
We would love you to join us, support the kids and share in a night filled with creativity, joy and inspiration.
The event is brought to live thanks to the support from Hutt City Council and local businesses and communities.

events.id: Young Photographer Award 2025-Little Theatre, 2 Queens Dr, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Young Photographer Award 2025
events.venue: Little Theatre, 2 Queens Dr, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Join us for the inaugural Young Photographer Award, the first event of its kind in New Zealand celebrating young creative talent aged 7 to 18.

Over the past year we have run more than 80 workshops and inspired over 180 kids to try photography. Many arrived with no previous experience and discovered a new way to express themselves. Some even chose photography as their future career. Our workshops are fully inclusive and also support kids who may need extra learning help, giving them a space to slow down, focus and build confidence through creativity.

Held in Lower Hutt, Wellington, this evening is all about creativity, wonder and community. Students who took part in our photography workshops will have their work displayed at the event, and our nominated young photographers will receive special awards recognising their talent, effort and unique way of seeing the world.

A creative evening for everyone
The event will be inspiring not only for young photographers but also for adults, families and anyone who enjoys creativity and photography. It is a great chance to support young talent, enjoy beautiful images and be part of a welcoming creative community.

Bring your friends and whānau. The more support we show our young photographers, the more their creativity shines and inspires others.

We are excited to welcome four inspiring speakers:

Etanah Lalau Talapa

The evening will open with a talk by Etanah Lalau Talapa, a multi-disciplinary artist and curator of Afega and Sa’anapu heritage from Samoa. Etanah holds a Bachelor of Design in Spatial Design from the College of Creative Arts at Massey University. Her work spans public installations, digital art, mixed media and photography. She often explores themes of motherhood, family lineage and the lived experiences of the Pacific diaspora in Aotearoa. Her practice focuses on discovering new visual languages that connect traditional and contemporary creative forms while honouring her Samoan cultural heritage.


Chris McKeown

Chris is a Wellington photographer whose work has been nominated for multiple awards and published widely. His work appears in calendars, prints, magazines, exhibitions, and large murals at Wellington Hospital, and he shoots the night sky, landscapes, and performance events. By day he is an executive, leadership mentor, and public speaker, with a passionate belief in compassionate leadership. Chris will share his journey to realising that slowing down and looking up can shift how we feel, think, and see the world and each other.


Miro Kennett

Miro Kennett (she/her) is a teen underwater photographer from Aotearoa NZ. Her work centres on capturing the underwater world and our connection to it. She spends most of her time photographing in Te Whanganui a Tara at Taputeranga Marine Reserve, exploring the coast and noticing how the ocean shifts each day. She has also captured images in the Poor Knights and Fiji. Through her photography she aims to share the beauty and life beneath the surface and inspire others to care for our marine environments.


Gareth Davies

Originally from Gloucester in the UK, Gareth has been passionate about photography since borrowing his grandparents’ Kodak film camera as a kid. He trained as a darkroom tech and photographer in the Royal Air Force, later becoming a photography instructor. After moving to Aotearoa, he went on to spend many years teaching forensic photography with NZ Police. Gareth now spends his spare time exploring Kapiti’s beaches and marine reserves, sharing his love of photography with anyone keen to learn.

events.id: Neural Calm Reset: Tapping for Your Nervous System-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Neural Calm Reset: Tapping for Your Nervous System
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
If moments of calm slip away as the day goes on, this workshop is designed to change that.

You’ll discover how to take control of your nervous system and cultivate a calm state that feels natural — all through a clear, 3-step framework.

This is not mindfulness. But a practice drawing on principles of memory biology and cognitive reconsolidation to help you interrupt stress signals at their source - the meaning level, where your nervous system responds to life’s challenges.

Calm becomes repeatable, a reliable part of everyday life.

You’ll walk away with a simple, 15-minute daily sequence built around three key steps:

* Tapping to deactivate the stress signal — a gentle, evidence-based technique to reset your nervous system.

* Bright-Side Rewrite Journal — shift your perspective and build empowering mental patterns.

* Inner Dialogue Reframe — transform the way you talk to yourself, supporting lasting calm and clarity.

Plus - your ticket includes a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert

Meet Krishnaloka, your host

Krishnaloka is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and psychology. As a mind technician trained in autaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.

events.id: Yin Yoga & Sound Healing-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Yin Yoga & Sound Healing
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Take an evening to slow down and reconnect. This session weaves together the meditative stillness of yin yoga with the restorative vibrations of sound healing — an immersive experience that invites both body and mind to unwind.

Through long-held yin postures, you’ll be guided to soften rather than strive, creating gentle openings and space for deeper release. The live sound journey adds another layer — resonant frequencies that ripple through the body, calming the nervous system and encouraging inner stillness.

Emma offers a trauma-informed yin practice grounded in compassion and self-awareness, drawing on her own personal growth and understanding of what it means to truly rest. Paired with Alex’s soundscapes, the evening becomes a tender exploration of presence and renewal.

We’ll close with a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert — a simple way to share warmth, grounding, and connection after the practice.

All levels are welcome.

Meet Emma, your yoga teacher
Emma holds a 100-hour trauma-informed Yin Yoga teacher certification, blending her corporate experience with a deep understanding of self-care. Emma's classes are designed to help create a safe space where you can relax and connect with your body. Her approach to teaching yin is purposeful, driven by a strong desire to empower students through mindful and compassionate practices. Her journey is rooted in self-growth and connection, with a strong focus on nourishing the body as an essential part of this.

Meet Alex, your sound healer
Alex is a sound healing practitioner devoted to nurturing healing in both mind and body. She believes that sound vibration holds the power to expand consciousness and restore harmony and balance in our lives. Her journey into sound healing began with the realization of how deeply sound vibration was affecting her psyche—making her more mindful of the music she listens to and the intention it carries. Along the way, she has drawn inspiration from artists such as Deva Premal, The Flying Mystics, Stevin McNamara, and the Bhakti Lounge Kirtan. Their music has profoundly influenced her own sound healing practice, inspiring her to explore sound as a tool for transformation, connection, and inner peace.

events.id: Dungeons and Dickens: A Crit'mas Carol-BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Dungeons and Dickens: A Crit'mas Carol
events.venue: BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington
events.long_description:
Bah, Humbug!

For better or for worse, the holidays are upon us, and this year the Last In Initiative team is making a list and checking it twice.

Join your fellow naughty listers for three nights of very merry mischief, magic, and mayhem.

Each night brings new antics as our four festive adventurers encounter ghostly apparitions, search for the perfect gift, and maybe, just maybe, warm their cold, cold hearts as they learn the true meaning of Christmas... the non-denominational, apolitical, Christmas-coded holidays.

So, don’t be a Scrooge.

Grab your dice, don your gay apparel, and shake off any festive blues.

Your DnD game might be on holiday hiatus, but for these elves, the rolls never stop.

Merry Crit’mas to all, and to all a good night!

events.long_description:
TITAN ENTERTAINMENT PRESENTS
A Night of Pleasure – New Zealand Tour 2025
New Zealand, it’s your turn — Pleasure P is bringing his chart-topping R&B sound to Aotearoa for A Night of Pleasure 2025, proudly presented by Titan Entertainment.
Performing live across nine cities, this will be the ultimate night for every R&B lover. From smooth slow jams like Under, Boyfriend #2, and Did You Wrong to the timeless Pretty Ricky bangers — Grind With Me, Your Body, Juicy, Love Like Honey, and On The Hotline — this tour delivers wall-to-wall vibes, nostalgia, and world-class performance.
Pleasure P’s voice defined an era, and now he’s bringing that same magic to the stage across Aotearoa.

Tour Dates
• Wednesday 10 December – Christchurch
• Thursday 11 December – Wellington
• Friday 12 December – Palmerston North
• Saturday 13 December – New Plymouth
• Wednesday 17 December – Gisborne
• Thursday 18 December – Rotorua
• Friday 19 December – Auckland

Have a girls night, bring along your dates, mates, and those you relate to for this local collaboration! events.id: Capital Blues Presents: Jamie and the Numbers-13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Capital Blues Presents: Jamie and the Numbers
events.venue: 13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Jamie and the Numbers are a Wellington soul‑funk outfit fronted by powerhouse vocalist Jamie Musuvā.
What began as a one‑off recording project quickly grew into a passion for Northern Soul, funk, and inventive covers, all delivered in their own unapologetically loud and soulful style. The band mixes original songs with cleverly re‑imagined classics, drawing praise for their debut album and earning airplay across New Zealand and even the BBC. With Jamie’s voice and a tight line‑up featuring Elliott Fuimaono and the Lerwill brothers, their live shows are renowned for energy, groove, and connection. Collaborations with producer Lee Prebble at The Surgery Studios and releases through Deltaphonic Records have cemented their reputation as one of Wellington’s most compelling soul‑funk acts.
It’s hard to describe how good this band is. You will just have to come and find out.

events.id: Diabetes NZ: Connect with Diabetes NZ Nelson Youth (Marlborough)-22 Queen Street, Blenheim Central, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Diabetes NZ: Connect with Diabetes NZ Nelson Youth (Marlborough)
events.venue: 22 Queen Street, Blenheim Central, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand
events.long_description:
An evening for everyone in Marlborough living with type 1 diabetes: Let’s connect, share ideas, and build our community.
Join Diabetes NZ Nelson Youth for a relaxed and friendly evening, supported by the Diabetes Nursing Team, open to all people in Marlborough living with type 1 diabetes - children, teens, young adults, and adults.
Whether you or your child is newly diagnosed or you’ve been navigating type 1 diabetes for years, we’d love to meet you.
Parents, carers, spouses, and other support people are welcome to attend alongside those living with type 1 diabetes.
We’ll chat about what Diabetes NZ Nelson Youth offers including social events, peer connections, and support for the whole family. Meet together with others at the Health Hub, with our Diabetes NZ Nelson Youth & Type 1 Coordinator joining online via Teams.
This is a great opportunity to talk about the kinds of activities or support you’d like to see and how we can work together.
Have questions? Email amanda@diabetes.org.nz.

events.id: The Hectet - Live And In Performance-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
events.name: The Hectet - Live And In Performance
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
The Hectet bring you a night of melodious and grooving electroacoustic jazz music, to celebrate the release of their debut album, Here Comes The Hectet, off the back of their recent Australian album release tour.

They will also be playing unreleased selections from their recently recorded follow-up album, French Politics, across two sets of original compositions by Hector McLachlan. The music of The Hectet draws from a wide pool of influences, reflecting an open and ambivalent attitude to genre that has given it a unique and broad appeal.

Hector (piano, synth) is a pianist and composer from Te Whanganui-a-Tara who has played across Aotearoa and the world with acts like Revulva, Salvia Palth, Rachel Andie, The Unknot, and The Teskey Brothers. He has also released an album of electronic music on US cassette label Become Eternal.

Joining him are three Pōneke demons: Phoebe Johnson (double bass), Jasper Holloway (guitar), and Abe Baillie (drums), as well as very special guest Lily Shaw (saxophone).

The Hectet aims to please, and they can't wait share their soulful and expressive stylings with you.

events.id: Climbing Film Tour 2025 - Wellington-205 Ohiro Road, Brooklyn, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Climbing Film Tour 2025 - Wellington
events.venue: 205 Ohiro Road, Brooklyn, Wellington
events.long_description:
EVENT POSTPONED
Tonight’s showing of the Climbing Film Tour has been postponed. The new date will be sometime in mid Dec, the current date is a placeholder, new date TBC
We apologise for the inconvenience and hope you can join us for the new showing once it’s been announced


———
NZAC Wellington is partnering with Vertical Life to bring you the annual Climbing Film Tour screening:
The Climbing Film Tour is back for its 6th season, featuring an impressive selection of short films that celebrate the global climbing community.
The Climbing Film Tour is a unique platform that allows climbers and filmmakers from around the world to share their stories with the community. Each year, films are submitted and selected by our Vertical Life climbing team to go on tour with screenings in hundreds of gyms, cinemas and other locations around the world. Films may vary between screenings.
The films are exempt from classification as sports documentaries, but are suitable for general audience viewing.
A huge thank you to our 2025 Tour Partners for their incredible support in making this tour possible: Wild Earth, Petzl, Scarpa, Nalgene, Arc'teryx, Cotopaxi, Suunto, Capital Brewing, The Crag and Vertical Life Magazine.

events.id: Henry Sherris Quintet-The Cavern Club, 22 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Henry Sherris Quintet
events.venue: The Cavern Club, 22 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Catch the Henry Sherris Quintet as they bring to life a set showcasing all original works, plus a few reimagined standards. Led by trumpet and alto, the group features Henry and Nicholas—musical partners since high school—alongside a fantastic rhythm section to perform a varied night of music from high-energy, bebop-inspired tunes to introspective ballads.

The compositions were first shaped during Henry’s time studying in New York, but have continued to evolve and grow as the band lends unique blend of swing, lyricism, and improvisation.

Featuring: Henry Sherris (trumpet), Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell (alto sax), Ayrton Foote (piano), Hikurangi Schaverien Kaa, (drums), Elijah Mulheron (bass).

events.id: KITA - Love Lives Here **revival + OHIMESAMA BREAKS-Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: KITA - Love Lives Here **revival + OHIMESAMA BREAKS
events.venue: Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
KITA 
Bass-heavy psych-pop

- KITA - lands on MOON for the first time in a few years, with live projection from Lucy Mila, and lights from The Doc Cave-Lynch! opening + closing BY OHIMESAMA BREAKS! Punctual departure, don't miss the take-off. A preview of their TWISTED FREQUENCY show.

8pm Doors / Opening by OHIMESAMA BREAKS
8:45pm - KITA -
10:15 Closing by OHIMESAMA BREAKS

Since releasing and touring their LOVE LIVES HERE EP in late 2023, the last two years have seen front-woman Nikita Tu-Bryant shoot and wrap her debut film featuring - KITA -
This summer, they are reviving their LOVE LIVES HERE Tour show with some added spice** in anticipation of their upcoming release of Tu-Bryant’s film.
Inspired by their EP LOVE LIVES HERE, the trilingual art-house film [ LOVE LIVES HERE ] is to be screened in 2026 on the film festival circuit around the globe.

Melding inspirations of folk, soul and psychedelia with the guitar and spirited storytelling of musician-actor Nikita Tu-Bryant (Avatar 2, Far North TV Series); the thick lushness of Moog bass synth and Fender Rhodes from Ed Zuccollo (Zuke); and the filthy drive and barking drums of Rick Cranson (Little Bushman) - KITA - have long-since solidified themselves as a must-see live band with a massive sound.
Over the years, you may have seen - KITA - main-stage with sets at SPLORE and WOMAD to the Wairarapa coasts at Tora Bombora and 121 Festival. Since their inception - KITA - have released 2 EPs and a debut album produced by Grammy-award winning Italian producer Tommaso Colliva (MUSE, RAZORLIGHT).

“ • KITA • are a vision straight from a synth-pop dream…the self-titled album • KITA • is a masterpiece ” - Muzic.net.nz

“To experience a • KITA • gig is to witness a stellar example of 3 strong musical identities ... fusing together to create a synergy and oneness unparalleled on the scene today.”
— Adam Page (WizardTone Studios AUSTRALIA)

The upcoming film is to be translated for a live cinema-stage show in late 2026 featuring live music from • KITA • playing a whole new original soundtrack, alongside a chorus of performers that echo the action and music on screen.

“ • KITA • have firmly established a reputation for their exceptional live performances, and their ability to connect people through music and storytelling.” - Ambient Light

events.venue: 8 Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Meet new people - Make international and local friends - Speak languages (mingle) - Have fun

................
Any question or request? Reach out to us on Instagram: www.instagram.com/blablalanguage
................
Join Our BlaBla Whatsapp Group: https://chat.whatsapp.com/LFeNVmzCnaG1BrHYpgBnqU
................
Stay updated via our Telegram channel: https://t.me/+n6e00r9ByRw0MmNk
................
Some guidelines for a delightful experience:
-
Our events are GRATIS, we will not charge you anything but You are asked to order a drink directly upon arrival to participate
(Mandatory).
-
Outside food and drinks are not allowed.
-
Please respect the venues staff and make sure to leave the place clean and tidy before you leave.
-
Be polite and respectful.
Please kindly note that venue staff or our organizers will ban you from our events and community without any warning if you don't respect it. We offer you opportunities to make friends and improve your language skills for free. Be nice enough to make things easy for us.
................
How it's working:
We are working with a mingle setup and we usually don't have designated language tables or areas.
English and the local language are typically spoken.
If you would like to speak other languages, please ask the organizers or seek participants who meet your language expectations.
................
Things to keep in mind before joining:
-
By attending our events, you consent to being photographed or filmed. Photos and videos taken during the events will be shared on our social media. If you do not wish to appear in the photos, please send us a private message as soon as possible on Instagram (@blablalanguage).
-
Remember to keep an eye on your belongings and prioritize your own well-being. We are not responsible for any lost items or personal issues.
................
/
Make a Difference with BlaBla: Volunteer as an Event Organizer (volunteering)!
These gatherings are brought to you by BlaBla Language Exchange, spanning over 150 cities across 5 continents. We are always looking for new organizers. More information and application here: https://www.blablalanguageexchange.com/event-organizers
................
/
Share your photography / video skills: Volunteer as photographer (volunteering)!
Are you a photo virtuoso or a video wizard?
Whether you're a pro or a passionate newbie, we want YOU!
No cash, but lots of laughs and fame (well, sort of). We'll even give you a virtual high-five!

events.id: Nadia Reid tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Nadia Reid tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Presented by: Banished Music "[Nadia] embraces a full-bodied sound halfway between Haim’s sophisticated pop sparkle and Sharon Van Etten’s full-throated songcraft" — The Guardian This December acclaimed songwriter Nadia Reid journeys back to New Zealand and Australia in celebration of Enter Now Brightness; her critically lauded fourth album which was released on Chrysalis in February 2025.
“There’s a questing robustness to these songs, a sense of somebody finally having the perspective to seek out answers to long-hanging questions.” ★★★★ — MOJO Enter Now feels different.
It is an album, she says, of departure and questioning, that has reminded her how songwriting can be “the most useful thing to do with pain and joy and thoughts and feelings and anger.” That through music we can find great change.
“I’m so much better off now that it exists,” she says.
“Now feels like a new time.”

events.id: Parent Support Group - Kapiti Coast-Sunday Cantina,1 Renown Rd, Raumati South, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu-All Events In
events.name: Parent Support Group - Kapiti Coast
events.venue: Sunday Cantina,1 Renown Rd, Raumati South, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Parent Support Group - Kapiti Coast
Grab a free coffee and chat with other parents and carers who know what it’s like to care for a disabled child, a neurodivergent child, or a child with health impairments.


Parent to Parent hosts regular Parent Support Groups in Kapiti Coast to support carers and parents just like you. These groups are a safe space for family and whānau to share their experiences, their challenges, their triumphs, and to learn from each other in an open and 100% judgement-free environment. No topic is too ‘weird’, no question too ‘out there’. We get it, and we are here to help.


So if you’d like to share a struggle, celebrate a success, raise a concern, or simply have a cuppa and chat with other parents and carers in your area, you are always welcome at our Parent Support Group. Drop in for as long or as short a time as you want.


Contact Meredith Dyer for more information:
| 027 808 3947
