events.name: LE MAU-"Sāmoa mo Sāmoa"
events.venue: Hutt City New Life Church,237 Cambridge Terrace, Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
LE MAU-"Sāmoa mo Sāmoa"
"Samoa filemu pea, ma si o'u toto ne'i ta'uvalea, a ia aoga lo'u ola mo lenei mea"- Tupua Tamasese Lealofi III

About this Event

TAUTUA DANCE PRESENTS.
LE MAU-"Sāmoa mo Sāmoa"
Event Location: Hutt City New Life Church
Join us for an inspiring production that highlights the journey of Sāmoa’s road to independence, a journey shaped by resilience and courage in the face of adversity. Feel the deep emotions of heartache and the joy of triumph as we celebrate our connection to the oceans and mountains. Experience the transformation from hiding our culture to embracing it with pride and determination.

Tautua Dance School invites you to embark on a powerful journey rooted in real stories of our people. Don’t miss this chance to be inspired—secure your tickets now and witness our amazing production.

TAUTUA!!! SAUUU IAAAA



Agenda


🕑: 06:00 PM - 06:30 PM
SIVA AFI SHOWCASE
Host: TAUTUA SIVA AFI CLASSES
Info: All our Tautua Siva Afi classes will be opening our night with their class routines they've been working on for the last two terms. The classes that will be on display are: PORIRUA BEGINNERS, HUTT VALLEY BEGINNERS, WELLINGTON BEGINNERS, PORIRUA INTERMEDIATE and our TAUTUA COMPETITORS.


🕑: 06:30 PM - 08:00 PM
LE MAU- SĀMOA MO SĀMOA
Info: !!!!PRODUCTION TIME!!!!


🕑: 08:00 PM - 09:00 PM
TAUTUA DANCE SCHOOL'S ANNUAL PRIZEGIVING
Info: Our annual prizegiving, where we get to honour our students in every class and find out who our TAUTUA STUDENT OF THE YEAR is.

events.long_description:
Cantina Comedy is back at Raumati's entertainment hub, Sunday Cantina.

12 comedians will be walking under the spot light to bring you the LOLs. Who will it be? It could be an experienced comedian, a newbie, a local mirth maker or a touring trouble maker.

What you going to hear? Well rehearsed script, a work in progress, a brand new joke, puns, improv, props but it is all designed to make you laugh.

You can also get involved. Drop a topic in the jar and few comedians will try to blind riff off them as they are drawn at random. Could be comedy gold or a complete car crash.

Gather your mate, buy your tickets and book a table. Come early and grab a meal before the fun starts.

events.name: In the Rume with
events.venue: 17 Parumoana Street, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It's here... Rume's very first large-scale event on Saturday 13th December in Porirua at Pātaka Art + Museum!
In the Rume with is an event designed for gals aged 17-35–a night of wholesomeness, curated spaces, and shared stories. It’s a parallel to our first online series where you'll be able to connect and talanoa in person with some of our featured women (announcing soon). 
Our heart is to build community for women through storytelling and connection. We believe there's room for everyone at the table and know that this will be a special evening where you can come and leave inspired.
You'll be free to enjoy the room at your pace, with immersive activations and surprise treats throughout the night. Of course we'll have yummy kai, snacks and drinks supplied by local sponsors. 
Get your besties together and make a gals night out of it!!! Don’t miss this opportunity to connect with gals in your community, learn from our beautiful features and have some fun before the end of the year. 
Tickets are very limited so get in quick! See you in the Rume 😍
P.S. check out our socials / website for more info!

events.id: Handel's Messiah-Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Wakefield Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Handel's Messiah
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Wakefield Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Celebrate the festive season with a magnificent performance of Handel’s Messiah on Saturday, 13 December, at 7:30 pm in the Michael Fowler Centre. Presented by Orpheus Choir Wellington in collaboration with Orchestra Wellington, this timeless masterpiece has been a beacon of holiday joy for centuries, blending grandeur, beauty, and drama in equal measure.

Under the direction of Brent Stewart, Music Director of Orpheus Choir Wellington and one of New Zealand’s leading conductors, this performance promises to capture the full brilliance of Handel’s most beloved work. From the exuberance of Worthy is the Lamb to the powerful The Trumpet Shall Sound and the transcendent Hallelujah Chorus, Messiah is a musical journey that inspires and uplifts like no other.

Joining Brent is a stellar lineup of soloists. Emma Pearson, recognised for her captivating performances on international stages, brings brilliance and artistry. Mezzo-soprano Maaike Christie-Beekman adds depth and warmth with her rich, expressive voice. Rising tenor Lila LJ Crichton contributes freshness and flair, while Lexus Song Quest winner Joel Amosa grounds the quartet with his commanding bass.

The Michael Fowler Centre, renowned for its superb acoustics and stunning architecture, provides the perfect setting for this extraordinary concert. With its sweeping choruses, unforgettable arias, and sheer emotional power, Messiah is the ultimate way to mark the festive season.

Come and join us for an evening of musical brilliance that will have you saying, Hallelujah!
events.description:
Celebrate the festive season with a magnificent performance of Handel’s Messiah on Saturday, 13 December, at 7:30 pm in the Michael Fowler Centre.
Under the direction of Brent Stewart, Music Director of Orpheus Choir Wellington and one of New Zealand’s leading conductors, this performance promises to capture the full brilliance of Handel’s most beloved work.
From the exuberance of Worthy is the Lamb to the powerful The Trumpet Shall Sound and the transcendent Hallelujah Chorus, Messiah is a musical journey that inspires and uplifts like no other.
Joining Brent is a stellar lineup of soloists.
Emma Pearson, recognised for her captivating performances on international stages, brings brilliance and artistry.

events.id: End of Year Party Time with The Closet-125 Featherston Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: End of Year Party Time with The Closet
events.venue: 125 Featherston Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Save the Date: Saturday, December 13!

The rumours are true… after much soul-searching (and to give our neighbours a breather!) The Closet is taking a year off from Kiwiburn. BUT ~ don’t worry the closet doors aren’t closing just yet… we're throwing an end of year party for you all to keep the fruity vibes alive!
We're bringing the pre-burn heat early this year with an epic night at our fabulous friends Champagnaria bar Otto, and we want your beautifully creative minds to help create the party…
Theme TBD >>>>
We want YOU to dream up the wildest, weirdest, most wonderful party themes you can think of. Send us your ideas & the top picks will go to a public vote.
Winner scores two FREE tickets + a bottle of bubbles to pop at the party!
The Lineup so far is already looking epic:
• Seraph – delivering her signature melodic uplifting magic
• Tori – back with the booty-shaking, baddy bass we all crave
• More DJs to be announced soon!
While we won’t be fundraising for the Burn this time, we are raising funds to secure long-term storage for our fabulous clothes & infrastructure… So The Closet can return next year bigger, better, and even more fabulous.
Stay tuned. Start dreaming. Get ready to party like its the end of 2025!

events.id: Star Time | Album Fundraiser Show @ Meow-9 Edward Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Star Time | Album Fundraiser Show @ Meow
events.venue: 9 Edward Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Aotearoa’s very own Afrobeat Jazz powerhouse STAR TIME is back for one more spectacle before the year ends, and it’s going to be their most special one yet.
In 2025, Star Time have embarked on an unprecedented run of music releases and performances, including the release of their debut singles “Moto Moto” and Cannon”, which proved themselves to be ones to watch amongst the live scene here in Aotearoa.
Alongside these achievements, they spent four days in the studio composing and perfecting their upcoming album, ‘We Are Here’ which is set to be released in 2026. In order to successfully fund the release of this project, they are putting on the ultimate Star Time experience one last time to wrap up 2025.
This also marks the last show send off for their fellow saxophonists Jack Harris and Isaac Randel as they head overseas next month for good.
If you cannot make the gig, there are options to donate via the ticketing link which will give money directly to the band, but will not grant entry to the show.
Special guests to be announced.

events.id: mHz : Brutalist Noise Ensemble v2 / Te Tumu-272 Taranaki Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: mHz : Brutalist Noise Ensemble v2 / Te Tumu
events.venue: 272 Taranaki Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Mo H. Zareei aka mHz is an Iranian sound artist and researcher based in New Zealand. His practice spans electronic compositions, kinetic sound-sculptures, and audiovisual installations. Using custom-built software and hardware, his work often aims to uncover the beauty in the fundamentals of sound and light production, and reductionist audiovisual elements that draw inspiration from physical and architectural principles.
Brutalist Noise Ensemble v2 involves a series of electromechanical instruments built to extend the territory of noise and glitch beyond the digital realm, while paying conscious homage to Brutalism: an unapologetic celebration of raw material through rigorous formalism, where noise replaces concrete. Despite its experimental raw materials, the formal structure of the work is established through purely grid-based and club-style rhythms and repetition is used to bring accessibility to noise.
https://millihertz.net/
https://vimeo.com/818597372
---
TE TUMU
Ka whakaputa mai au i Te Kore - From the Void I emerge. Ancient resonance future sound. Submerged dub rhythms and murky unprocessed bass with soaring taonga pūoro. Experimental, indigenous, slow dance.
$15 presales via UTR
$20 doors / $10 unwaged
Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

events.id: Girls Rock The Boys - Wellington-13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Girls Rock The Boys - Wellington
events.venue: 13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
POWERHOUSE WOMEN SINGERS: CLASSIC ROCK FROM THE BANDS OF MEN: A KICKASS LIVE BAND
Girls Rock the boys is back—bringing powerhouse vocals and legendary rock anthems to the stage.
This time, it’s Ashley Hale-Durham, Georgie Sullivan, and Julie Lamb leading the charge, with a stellar band behind them: Andrew Richardson (drums), Matt Fitzpatrick (bass), Aslan Rowlands (guitar), and Duncan Haynes (keys).
We’re diving deep into the golden era of rock—Journey, Whitesnake, Boston, Foreigner, Rainbow, and Deep Purple, all delivered with the energy of a rugby pitch and the comfort of your favourite dressing gown.
Whether you’re waving your phone torch to Foreigner, headbanging to Rainbow, or playing air guitar to Deep Purple, you’ll find something to do with yourself in every “mini EP” set.
The band are amazing - the singers nail it, and we've added new songs!
Need a breather? The wonders at Underworld will sort you a drink and a plate.
Feedback from our last gig: “Man did they ROCK! 4 very talented ladies and awesome band... the venue was rocking—check them out!”
Come and see us - we love it when you do!
🎟️ Early bird tickets just $20. Door sales $30.
💔 A special shout-out to our inaugural bass player, Callum Black, who’s heading overseas. You’ve been an inspiration, Callum. We’ll work to do you proud.

events.id: Fine Signs Crazyman 2025-Hutt City,49 Waterloo Rd, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Fine Signs Crazyman 2025
events.venue: Hutt City,49 Waterloo Rd, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Fine Signs Crazyman 2025
Established in 1991, the Fine Signs Crazyman is the Wellington region's longest running multisport event. Based around the icon outdoor elements of Hutt City, this 56k scenic tour showcases the hills, beaches, harbour and river that make our Capital the outdoor wonderland that it is.

Scheduled for December 14th in 2025, you can take it on either solo or in a team. Options include the full multisport format (13k Kayak, 28k Mountain Bike, 13k Trail Run) or the duathlon (mountain bike/trail run).

This challenging but achievable event embraces all ages, abilities and backgrounds. In short, you'd be "crazy not to" contemplate the Crazyman... It's a "Hell of an event"!

events.name: Stigmata: The Resurrection
events.venue: Ivy Bar and Cabaret, 63 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Tired of your usual Christmas themed drag shows and craving something a little more twisted? Back from the dead, Ness Quick brings you Stigmata, the Resurrection. Reject holiday cheer and join us in a celebration of all things sinful, join us as we delve deep into the twisted minds of our artists. From the Devil himself, to his sexy seven sins, all are welcome at Stigmata. So leave the rosary beads and home, and make sure to book a confession with priest beforehand, and come down to Ivy Bar for an evening so ungodly, Saint Nicholas will be leaving coal in your stocking for the rest of your life.

Hosted by Ness Quick,
Featuring;
Cailiah
Faux Femme
Veronica Heart
Miss Gendered
Maxxine Goth
Rocky Rhodes

We strive to provide a safe space for all queer people from all backgrounds. If concerned about the venue, access or any other queeries regarding the show, please send an email to croi.osullivan@gmail.com. You are also welcome to reach out via my Instagram, @theonly_nessquick
Doors open at 9:30 for a 10pm start. No Stag Dos

events.id: L-Side NZ Debut Tour (WLG)-17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: L-Side NZ Debut Tour (WLG)
events.venue: 17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We are stoked to present one of DnB’s best for his first ever show in the capital, the one and only L-Side!
Hailing from São Paulo, Brazil, L-Side has been a mainstay in the drum and bass scene worldwide with releases on labels such as V Recordings, Hospital Records, The North Quarter and many, many more. Developing his own unique style, L-Side is known for his contrast of upfront and aggressive rolling basslines, merged with funk and soul samples and vocals, which has forged a beautifully fresh take on drum and bass.
On support we have some heavy hitters from our endlessly talented Wellington community: Pearly, Echotek, Edii & Gusty as well as Rhythm Output’s very own Gos & Fe joined by Timmy P.
Event runs 11pm-3am

events.long_description:
Ngaio Village Christmas Market
Foxtail Events are bringing the Christmas spirit to Ngaio on Sunday, 14 December 2025 from 10am - 3pm at the Ngaio Town Hall!

Enjoy the aroma of brewed coffee, freshly baked good and delicious food from our food trucks / stalls while perusing the gorgeous selection of locally crafted products including:

• Plants, fresh flowers & seedlings
• Jewellery
• Clothing, bags and accessories
• Crochet & knitted toys
• Scented candles
• Homewares & soft furnishings
• Children & baby items
• Skincare, cosmetics, soaps & natural products
• Gifts & treasures
• Resin items
• Crystals
• Wooden & metal works
• Ceramics & pottery
• Pet accessories
• Carvings & sculptures
• Wool products
• Much much more!

Each stall will have either cash or eftpos facilities available, however it is best to bring cash to the market too.

This is a great opportunity to make the most of that last minute Christmas shopping, with one-of-a-kind gifts, decorations, and treats from some of Wellington's most talented crafters and artists!

A selection of Christmas music will get you in the festive mood to enjoy the atmosphere at the Ngaio Christmas Market!
events.description:
Ngaio Village Christmas Market Foxtail Events are bringing the Christmas spirit to Ngaio on Sunday, 14 December 2025 from 10am - 3pm at the Ngaio Town Hall!
Enjoy the aroma of brewed coffee, freshly baked good and delicious food from our food trucks / stalls while perusing the gorgeous selection of locally crafted products including: • Plants, fresh flowers & seedlings • Jewellery • Clothing, bags and accessories • Crochet & knitted toys • Scented candles • Homewares & soft furnishings • Children & baby items • Skincare, cosmetics, soaps & natural products • Gifts & treasures • Resin items • Crystals • Wooden & metal works • Ceramics & pottery • Pet accessories • Carvings & sculptures • Wool products • Much much more!
Each stall will have either cash or eftpos facilities available, however it is best to bring cash to the market too.
This is a great opportunity to make the most of that last minute Christmas shopping, with one-of-a-kind gifts, decorations, and treats from some of Wellington's most talented crafters and artists!
A selection of Christmas music will get you in the festive mood to enjoy the atmosphere at the Ngaio Christmas Market!

events.id: Wine Zen - A symphony for the senses-Allan Scott Bistro,Blenheim, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Wine Zen - A symphony for the senses
events.venue: Allan Scott Bistro,Blenheim, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wine Zen - A symphony for the senses
Take a breath and let your senses lead you. Join us for Wine Zen at Allan Scott Bistro at Allan Scott Family Winemakers – a sensory journey into mindfulness, connection, and the quiet beauty of wine.

We begin with a grounding meditation and explore five mindful techniques that awaken each of our senses before heading behind the scenes on a private tour with owner and winemaker Josh Scott.

The morning concludes in the Bistro with a guided sensory wine and food pairing that deepens our appreciation for flavour, texture, and the stories within each glass.

Spaces are limited! Reserve your place for a morning of calm, curiosity, and connection among the vines.

events.long_description:
☕🚨Coffee & Cars 🚨🚘
🚗☕ FREE EVENT - Coffee & Cars is back for Season 8! 🚗☕

We’re rolling into our eighth season of Coffee & Cars at Southward Car Museum!

Bring your pride and joy, check out an incredible mix of classics, customs, hot rods, and modern favourites - or just come along to enjoy the atmosphere.

📅 Upcoming Dates (weather dependent):

- Sunday 16 November 2025
- Sunday 14 December 2025
- Sunday 11 January 2026
- Sunday 8 February 2026
- Sunday 8 March 2026

🍔 Food & Drinks:
The Southward Coffee Stop is open for drinks & snacks (check out the new Milkshakes & Icies!)
We’ll also have the Coffee Cruisers + Food Trucks on-site plus the ever-popular BBQ Fundraiser - each month run by a different local sports club or organisation, so bring some change to support them.

💙 Look out for our Gulf GT40-inspired donation box near the museum entry!
Coffee & Cars is a FREE event and we love keeping it that way so everyone can come along and enjoy it. But, as you can imagine, it does cost a lot to run each season. If you’d like to help us keep the wheels turning, we’d be so grateful for any contribution - big or small. Every bit of support helps us keep Coffee & Cars running strong for the whole community. Thank you for helping us make this event possible 🙌

🚙 All Cars Welcome – classics, performance, JDM, vintage, muscle, daily drivers… if you love it, bring it.
🚗 Spectator Parking is also available on-site.

⚠️ Please note: There will be no October event this year as the last few October events have been rained off, so we’re looking forward to a dry & sunny start in November!

events.name: Kohael Sound Journey Paraparaumu
events.venue: 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032,91 Ruapehu St, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Kohael Sound Journey Paraparaumu
Come and be held in a ceremony of sound. Sunday 14th, from 2:22 PM to 4:04 PM at Lotus Yoga, Papamaru, an immersive Sound Journey awaits you.

This is a time and space to breathe, release, and be nurtured by the deep vibrations of medicinal instruments including Didgeridoo, HandPan, Jaw Harps, Shamanic Drone Flute, Shamanic Drum, Mongolian Throat Singing (Sygyt and Khoomei), and more — all amplified and layered through a loop station.

Comfortably lying down, you’ll be guided on a relaxing, clearing, and rejuvenating inner journey. This transformative experience supports your nervous system, helping to release tension and restore calm and presence.

Benefits of Sound Healing
-Mental clarity and emotional balance
-Deep relaxation and revitalization
-Enhanced focus and memoryBetter sleep quality
-Strengthened immune response
-Boosted creativity
-Heightened self-awareness and environmental sensitivity

What to Bring
- Comfortable clothing
- A mattress, pillow, blanket, eye mask — anything to support your full comfort
- Water bottle
- An open heart

Event GuidelinesTo create a held and focused space:
- Please silence your phone before entering
- Arrive on time — we recommend 2:12 for a smooth, grounded start. Doors close at 2:22 PM sharp.

Please book your ticket, place limited !


This offering is part of the Kohael Project, where I (Justin) and fellow co-creators offer well-being practices in exchange for koha or donation — supporting personal transformation and collective healing.
More info : https://kohael.com/Live music and more : https://www.youtube.com/@kohaelproject/playlists https://www.instagram.com/kohaelproject/
Support the project and the Kohael Truck : https://givealittle.co.nz/cause/kohaelprojectonwheels

Thank you for reading, and see you soon

.With gratitude and love,
Justin

events.id: The Tui Express-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: The Tui Express
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Travel in style behind steam locomotive Jb 1236 “Joanne”, hauling our fleet of comfortable Ao carriages – complete with large panoramic windows, air conditioning, and heating.
Sit back and enjoy a scenic journey from Plimmerton through Pukerua Bay, taking in the stunning coastal views and Kapiti Island as we head north through the Kapiti Coast and into the Manawatu countryside. The trip includes spectacular views of the Manawatu Gorge and the new Te Ahu a Turanga highway crossing the Tararua Ranges.
Our onboard buffet carriage will be open throughout the journey, offering a selection of food and drinks for purchase.
When we arrive at Mangatainoka, a short bus transfer (or an easy 10-minute walk) will take you to the Tui Brewery. There, you’ll enjoy a gourmet BBQ lunch served in the original Flagon Room, including a complimentary drink (beer, cider, or sauvignon blanc). Each guest also receives a Mangatainoka Passport filled with vouchers to redeem at the brewery.
Please select the lunch option when booking your train tickets.
⸻
Timetable
Outbound Departure Times
Plimmerton 7.45am
Paraparaumu 8.25am
Otaki 9.15am
Levin 9.50am
Palmerston North 10.50am
Mangatainoka 12.20pm
Return Arrival Times
Mangatainoka 2.25pm
Palmerston North 4.05pm
Levin 4.55pm
Otaki 5.25pm
Paraparaumu 5.10pm
Plimmerton 6.35pm
Please arrive at your boarding station at least 10 minutes before departure with your tickets ready.
⸻
Ticket Prices
From Plimmerton or Paraparaumu
• Adult: $145
• Child (under 16): $85
From Ōtaki or Levin
• Adult: $125
• Child (under 16): $65
From Palmerston North
• Adult: $85
• Child (under 16): $50
Tui Brewery BBQ Lunch + Complimentary Drink
• Adult: $45
• Child (under 16): $20
⸻
Limited Mobility Notice
Please note that our heritage carriages may not be suitable for passengers with limited mobility.
If you have any concerns, contact us at info@mainlinesteam.co.nz or phone 04 233 8131.

Bailamos Bachata! Christmas Dance Party 🎄
🔥 Please note: the event is free but it can only continue if we support the Southern Cross by buying food or drinks 🔥


🎄Wellington’s favourite monthly Bachata Latin dance party 🎄


We’re giving the Wellington teachers a much needed break, so the December Bailamos is going to be 100% social dancing.

Join us for an awesome night of bachata, along with a touch of salsa and a smattering of kizomba and zouk. We welcome everyone, from the absolute beginner to the most experienced dancer. We’re all about the joy of social dancing together.

Bailamos Bachata is hosted free of charge by the Southern Cross. They love the atmosphere we bring but we also need to support them in return. We’re asking everyone attending to purchase soft drinks, food or alcohol from the bar. It’s vital we show our gratitude.

See you there!

events.name: Ethereal Resonance - Sound Immersion
events.venue: Globe Theatre,318 Main St, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Ethereal Resonance - Sound Immersion
Please note - *THIS IS NOT A SEATED EVENT*.


Ethereal Resonance - Sound Immersion - what is it?

It is a time out.... time for you to focus on self-care, on rest and relaxation as you let the ethereal sounds of the magical quartz crystal singing bowls wash over you.


Please bring with you:
- A yoga mat or equivalent, floor cushions, gravity chair, blankets, pillows, to make a warm and comfortable cocoon, as you will be laying or sitting on a hard wooden floor.

- Any special taonga, crystals, essential oils, drink bottle, journal to aid in your experience.


Kaupapa:
- The evening's focus is about *Intentional Rest and Relaxation* - leave your cares behind as you enter the whare.

- Shoes off - there will be an area set aside in the room for shoes.

- We are in Globe 2 and the doors will be open at 6.10pm.

- Choose a spot and settle in before 6.25pm.

- Short mihi whakatau, housekeeping items. Sound immersion 45mins.

- Interval break: stretch, make a cuppa (herbal teas and dark chocolate provided) in the foyer.

- Resettle - sound immersion 45mins to 1hr.

- Closing karakia (8.30pm).


Koha:
- $25.00 - tickets available from the Globe Theatre, Palmerston North (limited numbers).


If you have any specific questions about the evening, please don't hesitate to contact me on 027 424 7054. I look forward to connecting with you.

Ngā mihi, Jodi

events.id: bar italia 'Some Like It Hot' Tour | WELLINGTON-Meow,17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: bar italia 'Some Like It Hot' Tour | WELLINGTON
events.venue: Meow,17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
bar italia 'Some Like It Hot' Tour | WELLINGTON
SATURDAY 13 DECEMBER - HOLLYWOOD AVONDALE, AUCKLAND
SUNDAY 14 DECEMBER - MEOW, WELLINGTON
with support from Ngahere Wafer

“...grungy, gritty, and a bit sexy” - Stereogum
“...swaggering and devastatingly cool” - NME

Hot on the heels of announcing their highly anticipated new album Some Like It Hot, the eternally enigmatic UK post-punk darlings bar italia have also unveiled two huge New Zealand shows for this December, brought to you by Strange News Touring and Banished Music. Saturday 13th of December, the band will take the stage at Auckland’s glorious Hollywood Avondale for an all-ages show, playing Meow in Wellington on Sunday 14th December.

After bursting onto the scene with two incredible albums in a single year - the brilliant Tracey Denim and the noisy niceness of The Twits - bar italia spent the next while earning a reputation as one of the best live bands in the game, including a sold out and sweaty show at Auckland’s Neck of the Woods. Since then, the band have been plotting their next move in world domination, dropping fan favourite single Cowbella in June, and this week lifting the lid on Some Like It Hot with accompanying tune Fundraiser - with a video featuring Matt “Super Hans” King.

The London based band, built around the core of Nina Cristante, Jezmi Tarik Fehmi and Sam Fenton, may have looked to be hiding out this year while cooking up this new batch of tunes, but in reality they’ve been anything but dormant. Cristante teamed up with Yves Tumor for a dangerously good duet on We Don’t Count, while Jezmi and Sam dropped another full-length album under their Double Virgo moniker just last month.

With the album dropping on Matador this October, local fans will have a couple of short months to learn the words and get ready to scream and swoon along when bar italia hit our shores this December. Shit yeah!

bar italia 'Some Like It Hot' Tour | WELLINGTON

The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

Come support local at our monthly market in Wellington City on the Waterfront at Wharewaka O Poneke venue.

events.id: Natural Textured Rings-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Natural Textured Rings
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Make your own personalised ring - a gift for yourself or someone special! :-)

Learn the basic technique first in copper or brass, and then craft your final piece in silver!

Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. Use feathers, leaves, or fabrics to create a unique texture for a beautiful ring!

Learn to measure your finger, cut metal to length and texture it without rolling mill, hammers and punches. Then use a jewellers torch, sandpaper and polishing, and your beautiful new ring will be ready to wear.

This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.

Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, a sterling silver ring strip and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by adults.

events.id: Ngaio Village Christmas Market-Ngaio Town Hall, 1 Ottawa Rd, Ngaio, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Ngaio Village Christmas Market
events.venue: Ngaio Town Hall, 1 Ottawa Rd, Ngaio, Wellington
events.long_description:
Foxtail Events are bringing the Christmas spirit to Ngaio on Sunday, 14 December 2025 from 10am - 3pm at the Ngaio Town Hall!

Enjoy the aroma of brewed coffee, freshly baked good and delicious food from our food trucks / stalls while perusing the gorgeous selection of locally crafted products including:

- Plants, fresh flowers & seedlings
- Jewellery
- Clothing, bags and accessories
- Crochet & knitted toys
- Scented candles
- Homewares & soft furnishings
- Children & baby items
- Skincare, cosmetics, soaps & natural products
- Gifts & treasures
- Resin items
- Crystals
- Wooden & metal works
- Ceramics & pottery
- Pet accessories
- Carvings & sculptures
- Wool products
- Much much more!

Each stall will have either cash or eftpos facilities available, however it is best to bring cash to the market too.

This is a great opportunity to make the most of that last minute Christmas shopping, with one-of-a-kind gifts, decorations, and treats from some of Wellington's most talented crafters and artists!

A selection of Christmas music will get you in the festive mood to enjoy the atmosphere at the Ngaio Christmas Market!

An international medal winning Sweet Adelines women’s barbershop chorus based in Petone. They love being a part of the greater Wellington community and sing to support events like Music at the Begonia as well as many others around the region.

events.id: Pottery Paint a Pint at HEY DAY Beer Co!-Heyday Beer Co,264a Cuba Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Pottery Paint a Pint at HEY DAY Beer Co!
events.venue: Heyday Beer Co,264a Cuba Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Pottery Paint a Pint at HEY DAY Beer Co!
PAINT AND SIP style workshop, enjoying craft beer while you use ceramic paints to decorate your own pottery tumbler. A perfect Sunday arvo!

About this Event

Join us for a relaxing arvo painting your very own handmade ceramic tumbler using pottery underglaze paints.
Enjoy one complimentary beer on arrival, with additional drinks and food available to purchase while you create.
Sophie from Sophie Florence Ceramics has handcrafted each tumbler and will guide you through the workshop. Afterward, leave your masterpiece to be professionally fired and ready for pickup and use before Christmas!
Not feeling creative? No stress—there’ll be plenty of inspo to spark ideas. Grab some friends for a unique end-of-year wind-down, or come solo and meet some like-minded people.
Heyday is a supervised venue; attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian.

events.id: Kohael Sound Journey Paraparaumu-91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Kohael Sound Journey Paraparaumu
events.venue: 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Come and be held in a ceremony of sound.
Sunday 14th, from 2:22 PM to 4:04 PM at Lotus Yoga, Papamaru, an immersive Sound Journey awaits you.
This is a time and space to breathe, release, and be nurtured by the deep vibrations of medicinal instruments including Didgeridoo, HandPan, Jaw Harps, Shamanic Drone Flute, Shamanic Drum, Mongolian Throat Singing (Sygyt and Khoomei), and more — all amplified and layered through a loop station.
Comfortably lying down, you’ll be guided on a relaxing, clearing, and rejuvenating inner journey. This transformative experience supports your nervous system, helping to release tension and restore calm and presence.
Benefits of Sound Healing
Mental clarity and emotional balance
Deep relaxation and revitalization
Enhanced focus and memory
Better sleep quality
Strengthened immune response
Boosted creativity
Heightened self-awareness and environmental sensitivity
What to Bring
Comfortable clothing
A mattress, pillow, blanket, eye mask — anything to support your full comfort
Water bottle
An open heart
Event Guidelines
To create a held and focused space:
Please silence your phone before entering
Arrive on time — we recommend 2:12 for a smooth, grounded start. Doors close at 2:22 PM sharp.
This offering is part of the Kohael Project, where I (Justin) and fellow co-creators offer well-being practices in exchange for koha or donation — supporting personal transformation and collective healing.
More info : https://kohael.com/
Live music and more : https://www.youtube.com/@kohaelproject/playlists
https://www.instagram.com/kohaelproject/
Support the project and the Kohael Truck : https://givealittle.co.nz/cause/kohaelprojectonwheels
Thank you for reading, and see you soon.
With gratitude and love,
Justin

Elite Dance Company welcomes you to our 2025 concert All Aboard.

events.id: Still Not Dead - Rachel McAlpine & The Andrew London Duo-Kapiti Playhouse, 7 Ruahine St, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Still Not Dead - Rachel McAlpine & The Andrew London Duo
events.venue: Kapiti Playhouse, 7 Ruahine St, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
After recovering from a shocking epiphany (OMG I'm getting old!), popular poet Rachel McAlpine started unpicking the mysteries of old age. Results: a best-seller book of poems, How To Be Old. A sell-out play, The Secret Lives of Extremely Old People. A podcast, Learning How To Be Old. And it seems at 85 she's still not done and still not dead. She reads selections.

On the cusp of receiving the mythical Gold Card, satirical songwriter/guitarist Andrew London and partner Kirsten assemble a selection of age-related songs from both original and borrowed repertoires, to compliment Ms McAlpine's meanderings. 'When I'm 64' is almost too obvious to include but...

Could ace harmonica virtuoso Coral Trimmer make a surprise appearance? We think so. You can expect more afternoon events from these people from now on. The bar will be open.
events.description:
After recovering from a shocking epiphany (OMG I'm getting old!
A sell-out play, The Secret Lives of Extremely Old People.
A podcast, Learning How To Be Old.
She reads selections.
On the cusp of receiving the mythical Gold Card, satirical songwriter/guitarist Andrew London and partner Kirsten assemble a selection of age-related songs from both original and borrowed repertoires, to compliment Ms McAlpine's meanderings.

Wellington’s favourite monthly Bachata Latin dance party

We’re giving the Wellington teachers a much needed break, so the December Bailamos is going to be 100% social dancing.
Join us for an awesome night of bachata, along with a touch of salsa and a smattering of kizomba and zouk. We welcome everyone, from the absolute beginner to the most experienced dancer. We’re all about the joy of social dancing together.

See you there!

events.name: Doubtful Sounds at Wellington
events.venue: 293 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Bryan Crump and the Doubtful Sounds are back!
If you love songs by Straitjacket Fits, The Beths, Don McGlashan, ABBA , Joni Mitchell and more, well, you’ve never heard the Doubtful Sounds sing them! High energy musical director Bryan Crump, of RNZ fame, leads the choir in original a cappella arrangements of pop songs from New Zealand and the world.
Doubtful Sounds won silver in the Pop Ensembles category at The World Choir Games in 2024, but they haven’t performed in Wellington for some time. The drought is over and you can see them in concert at 6.30pm on Sunday 14 December 2025 at the Thistle Hall at 293 Cuba Street. Doors open at 6pm.

events.id: Bar Italia (UK) 'Some Like It Hot' NZ Tour-Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Bar Italia (UK) 'Some Like It Hot' NZ Tour
events.venue: Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
SATURDAY 13 DECEMBER - HOLLYWOOD AVONDALE, AUCKLAND
SUNDAY 14 DECEMBER - MEOW, WELLINGTON

“...grungy, gritty, and a bit sexy” - Stereogum
“...swaggering and devastatingly cool” - NME

Hot on the heels of announcing their highly anticipated new album Some Like It Hot, the eternally enigmatic UK post-punk darlings bar italia have also unveiled two huge New Zealand shows for this December, brought to you by Strange News Touring and Banished Music. Saturday 13th of December, the band will take the stage at Auckland’s glorious Hollywood Avondale for an all-ages show, playing Meow in Wellington on Sunday 14th December.

After bursting onto the scene with two incredible albums in a single year - the brilliant Tracey Denim and the noisy niceness of The Twits - bar italia spent the next while earning a reputation as one of the best live bands in the game, including a sold out and sweaty show at Auckland’s Neck of the Woods. Since then, the band have been plotting their next move in world domination, dropping fan favourite single Cowbella in June, and this week lifting the lid on Some Like It Hot with accompanying tune Fundraiser - with a video featuring Matt “Super Hans” King.

The London based band, built around the core of Nina Cristante, Jezmi Tarik Fehmi and Sam Fenton, may have looked to be hiding out this year while cooking up this new batch of tunes, but in reality they’ve been anything but dormant. Cristante teamed up with Yves Tumor for a dangerously good duet on We Don’t Count, while Jezmi and Sam dropped another full-length album under their Double Virgo moniker just last month.

With the album dropping on Matador this October, local fans will have a couple of short months to learn the words and get ready to scream and swoon along when bar italia hit our shores this December. Shit yeah!
Tickets on sale now at Banished Music

events.id: Cryptopsy-Valhalla, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Cryptopsy
events.venue: Valhalla, Wellington
events.description:
Valhalla Touring are proud to announce direct from Canada, one of the worlds most brutal Death Metal bands, the mighty CRYPTOPSY, headlining 2 shows to close out the year of 2025, on their ALL SO VILE tour!!!
More than 30 years into their storied career, Montreal Death Metal innovators Cryptopsy return with their ninth studio album, An Insatiable Violence, set for release on June 20, 2025 on Season of Mist.
Revered in extreme Metal circles for such groundbreaking classics as 1994’s Blasphemy Made Flesh and the 1996 magnum opus None So Vile, Cryptopsy find yet another gear on An Insatiable Violence, which further solidifies the band’s place in the upper echelon of Death Metal.
Coming out of the pandemic, the band dedicated themselves to staying on top of their game more than ever before, with the intention of consistently putting out a new record every two years.
That started with 2023’s acclaimed As Gomorrah Burns, which WON them a CANADIAN GRAMMY, and continues 21 months later with An Insatiable Violence.

events.venue: 7 Sheffield St, Paraparaumu 5032
events.long_description:
Āhuru Mōwai Trust Sensory Session - Rebound
Āhuru Mōwai Trust Sensory Sessions are held weekly at Rebound, Playland and Trampoline Park, in Paraparaumu.

Session Details:
When: Mondays (Yes, even in the school holidays!)
Time: 5:30pm-7:30pm
Cost: $10 per family (immediate, not extended)
Who: School aged children with extra and special needs and their parents, guardians, family members, carers, siblings.
Upon entry you will be required to register your attendance.

If you are looking to have a birthday celebration at one of these sessions please txt Paul on 0272787087, or message us in advance. We would also encourage you to make use of a party room to host additional guests (an extra charge would apply to guests)

Come along in any dynamic that suits the family, to these relaxed and open sessions for families and kids living with special needs of all kinds.

Although we cannot cater to everyone's needs, we will do our best to support families to overcome obstacles to attend the sensory sessions.

Please speak with trustees regarding concerns.
(I.D or needs verification may be required at Trustee discretion).
Disclaimer: WE WILL GENTLY AND KINDLY TURN AWAY ANYONE WE FEEL SHOULD NOT BE THERE, AND WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO DO SO

events.id: CRYPTOPSY - ALL SO VILE - NZ 2025 - WELLINGTON-Valhalla,154 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: CRYPTOPSY - ALL SO VILE - NZ 2025 - WELLINGTON
events.venue: Valhalla,154 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
CRYPTOPSY - ALL SO VILE - NZ 2025 - WELLINGTON
+++++ 𝐂𝐑𝐘𝐏𝐓𝐎𝐏𝐒𝐘 - 𝐀𝐋𝐋 𝐒𝐎 𝐕𝐈𝐋𝐄 - 𝐍𝐙 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟓 𝐓𝐎𝐔𝐑 +++++

A vital force in Canadian technical death metal from 1993 onwards, 𝗖𝗿𝘆𝗽𝘁𝗼𝗽𝘀𝘆 won the hearts of fans worldwide with the masterful viciousness of their mid-'90s double-punch classics Blasphemy Made Flesh (1994) and None so Vile (1996). Featuring founding member / drumming maestro Flo Mounier alongside gravel-toned vocalist Matt McGachy, guitarist Christian Donaldson (both of whom have been with the group for two decades) and bassist since 2012 Olivier Pinard, 𝗖𝗿𝘆𝗽𝘁𝗼𝗽𝘀𝘆's Grammy award-winning album As Gomorrah Burns (2023, Nuclear Blast) signalled a productive new era for the unrepentantly aggressive Montreal four-piece, who have vowed to release a new record every two years.

𝗖𝗿𝘆𝗽𝘁𝗼𝗽𝘀𝘆 are bringing their 𝗔𝗟𝗟 𝗦𝗢 𝗩𝗜𝗟𝗘 tour down under this December just before Christmas, blasting local punters with sounds from their ninth studio album An Insatiable Violence and more!


𝐂𝐑𝐘𝐏𝐓𝐎𝐏𝐒𝐘 - 𝐀𝐋𝐋 𝐒𝐎 𝐕𝐈𝐋𝐄 - 𝐍𝐙 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟓 𝐓𝐎𝐔𝐑
Sunday 14th December - Whammy Bar, Auckland
Monday 15th December - Valhalla, Wellington

𝐓𝐈𝐂𝐊𝐄𝐓𝐒 𝐎𝐍 𝐒𝐀𝐋𝐄 𝐍𝐎𝐖 𝐕𝐈𝐀 𝐔𝐓𝐑.𝐂𝐎.𝐍𝐙

events.id: Jazz and Beyond Workshops 2025-91 Kelburn Parade, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Jazz and Beyond Workshops 2025
events.venue: 91 Kelburn Parade, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Jazz and Beyond for students 19 and under
December 15–18, 2025
Coordinated by Chris Beernink, Dave Wilson, Daniel Hayles, and Lance Philip. Proudly supported by the Tauranga Jazz Society.
Take your playing to the next level at the Jazz and Beyond Workshops! Young musicians from across Aotearoa come together to dive into jazz and connected styles, working closely with some of the country’s leading performers and educators. In a friendly, inclusive environment, you’ll grow your skills, make new musical connections, and learn alongside other students your age from all around the motu.
Here’s what’s in store:
small group ensembles led by professional musicians
developing improvisation skills in supportive settings
an introduction to music production
listening sessions that expand your skills
inclusive jam sessions where all are welcome
ensemble performances at the end of week concert
And more!
If you're 19 or under with at least a year of experience on your instrument or in vocal training, you’re welcome to join. Choose from trumpet, trombone, saxophone, clarinet, flute, bass, piano, guitar, drums, vibraphone, or voice.
The workshops are held at the New Zealand School of Music—Te Kōkī at Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington. Follow the Jazz and Beyond Workshops on Instagram or Facebook for the latest updates. Email jazzandbeyondworkshops@gmail.com with any questions.
Schedule
The workshops run 9:00am–4:30pm Monday through Thursday, with evening activities including concerts and our inclusive jam sessions Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Students perform in a closing concert on Thursday afternoon.
Accommodation
Students arrange their own accommodation. Often students from outside Wellington stay together in groups with a parent chaperone. Options for housing near Victoria University of Wellington include backpacker hostels and hotels. If you have a group of 15 or more, University Student Housing can been booked at Cumberland House. Contact info for this option is via email at Cumberland-House@vuw.ac.nz or by phone at +64 4 463 4770.
Meals
Lunch for the four days is available for purchase at many convenient locations on campus, or students may bring their own lunch.
Equipment
Provided equipment includes drum kits, guitar and bass amps, pianos/keyboards, microphones and PAs for vocalists.
All brass and wind players should bring their own instruments.
Drummers: you are required to bring your own cymbals, sticks, and hi-hat clutch.
Guitarists and bass players: you are required to bring your own instruments as well as cables (leads).
Preparation
All students with one year of experience on an instrument or in vocal training have the skills required to participate, so no musical preparation is required. On the first day, students will play a very short audition to be placed in an appropriate ensemble. Guidelines for this short audition will be sent to all registered participants in advance of the workshops.
Cost
Early bird price: $325 - register by 19th October
Standard price $350 - after 19th October
Registration is open to all until all spots are filled.
We are dedicated to ensuring all students can participate in the workshops without financial constraints. If the cost poses a barrier, please email us at jazzandbeyondworkshops@gmail.com and we will find a solution to facilitate your participation!
events.description:
Take your playing to the next level at the Jazz and Beyond Workshops!
If you're 19 or under with at least a year of experience on your instrument or in vocal training, you’re welcome to join.
All brass and wind players should bring their own instruments.
Preparation All students with one year of experience on an instrument or in vocal training have the skills required to participate, so no musical preparation is required.
On the first day, students will play a very short audition to be placed in an appropriate ensemble.

events.id: Youth Futsal Tournament 2025-72 Kemp St, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Youth Futsal Tournament 2025
events.venue: 72 Kemp St, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Youth Futsal Championships will be held at Ākau Tangi Sports Centre, Kilbirnie, Wellington on Monday 15th - Thursday 18th December 2025.
The Youth Futsal Championships is the national tournament for our region's best youth Futsal players to compete against other players from around New Zealand.
The U15 teams will play on a small-size futsal court and the U17 and U19 teams will play on a large-size futsal court.
For more information about the competition: https://www.nzfootball.co.nz/.../youth-futsal-championship-1
Registrations to trial for 2025 will open soon.
Marist will have a team in each girls and boys grade (U15, U17 and U19 years old).
There is no cost to trial but if selected, the programme fee per player is between $550 - $650. This includes all training and competition costs. The player fee will be confirmed after trials are complete.
N.B., We understand this is a busy time of year for players, therefore it is not compulsory for trialists to make all trial dates. Please confirm what trials you will attend in your registration form.
* An example to be eligible for Under 19s: All Players must be a maximum of 19 years old by the end of the calendar year in which Youth Futsal Champs 2025 is played - All Players of each Participant Team were born on or after January 1, 2006.
2006 & 2007 - Under 19s
2008 & 2009 - Under 17s
20010 & 2011 - Under 15s

events.id: CRYPTOPSY - ALL SO VILE - NZ 2025 - WELLINGTON-154 Vivian Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: CRYPTOPSY - ALL SO VILE - NZ 2025 - WELLINGTON
events.venue: 154 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
+++++ 𝐂𝐑𝐘𝐏𝐓𝐎𝐏𝐒𝐘 - 𝐀𝐋𝐋 𝐒𝐎 𝐕𝐈𝐋𝐄 - 𝐍𝐙 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟓 𝐓𝐎𝐔𝐑 +++++
A vital force in Canadian technical death metal from 1993 onwards, 𝗖𝗿𝘆𝗽𝘁𝗼𝗽𝘀𝘆 won the hearts of fans worldwide with the masterful viciousness of their mid-'90s double-punch classics Blasphemy Made Flesh (1994) and None so Vile (1996). Featuring founding member / drumming maestro Flo Mounier alongside gravel-toned vocalist Matt McGachy, guitarist Christian Donaldson (both of whom have been with the group for two decades) and bassist since 2012 Olivier Pinard, 𝗖𝗿𝘆𝗽𝘁𝗼𝗽𝘀𝘆's Grammy award-winning album As Gomorrah Burns (2023, Nuclear Blast) signalled a productive new era for the unrepentantly aggressive Montreal four-piece, who have vowed to release a new record every two years.
𝗖𝗿𝘆𝗽𝘁𝗼𝗽𝘀𝘆 are bringing their 𝗔𝗟𝗟 𝗦𝗢 𝗩𝗜𝗟𝗘 tour down under this December just before Christmas, blasting local punters with sounds from their ninth studio album An Insatiable Violence and more!

𝐂𝐑𝐘𝐏𝐓𝐎𝐏𝐒𝐘 - 𝐀𝐋𝐋 𝐒𝐎 𝐕𝐈𝐋𝐄 - 𝐍𝐙 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟓 𝐓𝐎𝐔𝐑
Sunday 14th December - Whammy Bar, Auckland
Monday 15th December - Valhalla, Wellington
𝐓𝐈𝐂𝐊𝐄𝐓𝐒 𝐎𝐍 𝐒𝐀𝐋𝐄 𝐍𝐎𝐖 𝐕𝐈𝐀 𝐔𝐓𝐑.𝐂𝐎.𝐍𝐙

events.id: Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - A Starry Christmas-The Arborist Rooftop Bar, 166 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - A Starry Christmas
events.venue: The Arborist Rooftop Bar, 166 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

events.id: Teulo Talks: Studio – Where Fashion Meets Technology with Anouk Wipprecht-Level 3/78 Victoria Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Teulo Talks: Studio – Where Fashion Meets Technology with Anouk Wipprecht
events.venue: Level 3/78 Victoria Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Step inside the studio for an exclusive live recording of Teulo Talks: Studio with internationally acclaimed FashionTech designer Anouk Wipprecht.
This intimate session will be filmed in front of a small audience in Wellington, capturing the conversation as part of a special online release coming in January 2026.

By attending, you agree to be part of the live studio audience and may appear on camera.
In this session, Anouk explores the intersection of fashion, technology, and human interaction—sharing how sensors, robotics, and 3D printing are reshaping design.

Limited to 15 guests, this is a rare opportunity to witness a world leader at work and experience how innovation comes to life on the cutting edge of wearable technology.
CPD points will be allocated for the online recording once released.

events.name: Robin Hood The Panto Audio Described Performance and touch tour
events.venue: 1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
5.30pm touch tour and 6.30pm audio described performance.
Access ticket $25pp with a free companion/whānau.
Let us know any other access requirements when booking. Service dogs and wheelchairs welcome.
To book email circa@circa.co.nz or call the box office on 04 8017992.
Adventures of the original working-class hero and man in tights!
Robin Hood steals from the rich and gives to the poor in an oldie timey place where people are struggling and homeless and the landed gentry hoard the money all for themselves – Wellington 2025.
Robin must stop the Evil Sheriff from running roughshod over the citizens! But this quest is far from easy… there is archery, swordfights, and a lot of dance numbers to get through. Our hero is grateful for help from spies on the inside: Maid Marion, and her bolshie Nanny (Pantomime Dame Jthan Morgan).
Come one and come all to see the slings and arrows of outrageous panto!

events.id: Last one for 2025 - 16 Dec-Central City, Wellington, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Last one for 2025 - 16 Dec
events.venue: Central City, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

Join the event waitlist if meetings are full - a space often comes up!

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple and proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

events.id: Welly On Wheels Kilbirnie - Confidence & Skills for Biking-Switched on Bikes, Wellington Waterfront 15/22 Herd Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Welly On Wheels Kilbirnie - Confidence & Skills for Biking
events.venue: Switched on Bikes, Wellington Waterfront 15/22 Herd Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Wellington City Council and Pedal Ready are teaming up to run social bike tours of the cycle routes in Kilbirnie and the surrounding area. Build confidence and skills to travel safely and efficiently by paihikara (bike) while getting to know the cycle routes in Kilbirnie!

Rides start and finish at Switched On HQ on the waterfront. A great way to exercise your newfound cycling skills and confidence on a fun social ride!

Please allow 2 hours for the ride. Arrive 30 minutes early if you are renting a bike.

These rides are suitable for people who:
- Know how to ride a bike but aren't yet travelling by bike in the city; or
- Those travelling by bike in the city but would like to gain confidence; or
- Those who want to learn how to use new infrastructure.

Open to riders aged 18+ (or 13+ if accompanied by an adult). Families are also welcome to bring younger children on cargo bikes or bike seats provided themselves. Please enquire directly with Switched on Bikes if you'd like to borrow a bike seat for the tour.

An electric bike is strongly recommended to participate in this ride. Thanks to Switched on Bikes and Wellington City Council, you can rent an electric bike for just $10 if you don't have access to one. Please book that separately here: https://switchedonbikes.rezdy.com/642002/electric-bike-hire-welly-on-wheels

You can either leave the bike with us after the tour and make your own way home (there are regular buses that depart regularly to the city from the Kilbirnie bus depot) or come back with us to Switched On HQ. If you're feeling extra enthusiastic and want to extend your ride overnight, you're welcome to hold onto the bike for free and return it before 9am to Switched on Bikes. You can also hold onto the bike and return it at the end of Thursday at a discounted cost of $...! You can decide what you'd like to do as late as the end of the guided ride on Wednesday.

If you would like to learn to ride a bike away from the road, check out the free Pedal Ready courses on their website. Any pātai (questions) about these tours please get in contact: tours@wcc.govt.nz.

PRIVACY STATEMENT: The information you shared in signing up for this ride is used for booking and safety purposes. Within 14 days after the tour, your name and emergency contact details will be deleted. Other information provided may be stored anonymously to support our project evaluation. Your email address will be stored for up to 4 months following the tour. Within that time, we may contact you with follow-up information about biking in Pōneke, as well as feedback opportunities about the ride and the impact it has had on your travel around Pōneke. You have the right to ask for a copy of any personal information we hold about you and to ask for it to be corrected if you believe it is incorrect. If you would like to ask for a copy of your information or to have it corrected, please contact us at tours@wcc.govt.nz.

events.id: Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat-Gryphon Theatre, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat
events.venue: Gryphon Theatre, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Fun, family .... and fantasies of fratricide!

The famous first musical written by Andrew LLoyd Weber and Tim Rice as teenagers, still performed around the world today.

Joseph is his father's favourite child. After dad Jacob gives Joseph an amazing coloured coat, his jealous brothers plot to get rid of him - but things don't quite work out as planned and Joseph goes on a big journey which ends in fame, fortune and - in the end, forgiveness.

The original story dates from many hundreds of years ago, Lloyd Webber and Rice created the piece in 1968 and today 1st Gear Productions is bringing a quirky new look to this musical classic.

With an onstage cast of just eight and a live band of five, set in the intimate space of the Gryphon Theatre, it's a fast and funny take on a classic aimed at people of all ages and offering pure fun for the festive season.

events.long_description:
It’s been another interesting year for Aotearoa’s screen industry, now it’s time to reflect, raise a glass, and celebrate together!
Join the writers, directors, editors, actors, stunties, crew, producers, postproduction and VFX magicians and all the screen creators who keep the cameras rolling and the stories flowing.
The Combined Guilds Xmas Parties are your chance to reconnect with old friends, meet new collaborators, and enjoy a well-earned festive catch-up with good people who get it.
 What’s included:
Your $10 ticket covers a bar tab and snacks
A warm, welcoming mix of industry whānau across all screen guilds
The perfect chance to unwind, swap stories, and toast to another creative year
Whether you’ve been on set, in post, behind the scenes, or in front of the camera, come celebrate the people who make Aotearoa’s screen industry what it is, one big circus family.
Tickets: $10 per person – includes bar tab + snacks

events.name: RYANOSAURUS NZ TOUR - WELLINGTON
events.venue: behind Moon Bar 167 Riddiford Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Ryanosaurus New Zealand only tour!
NEWTOWN MOON WELLINTON THURSDAY 18th DECEMBER 2025
TUBS AUDIO SOUND SYSTEM
THIS IS NOT ONE TO BE MISSED! LIMITED TICKETS AVAILABLE
The Ryanosaurus sound is a monstrous mix of bigbasslines, glitchy soundscapes and emotive melody with a sly playfulness.
The project blurs the line between many genres, but has its soul planted in psytrance. The project begun as a place to release the solo trancework of Ryan Whare from Australia.
With a drive for interesting but crisp and powerful production, the psychedelic trance genre was an instant attraction. Afteryears of cutting his teeth on the Australian circuit and writing with Mr Bill for his duo project Electrocado, Ryan begun releasing Ryanosaurus, and quickly built up a following for his unique style.
He has now had releases on labels around the globe such as; Zenon, Iboga, Kinematic,Merkaba, Hommega, Gravitas and many more. His touring record is extensive across mainstages at many of the nicest festivals around the world and he tours regularly through Australia, Europe and America. Somestand outs being; Boom (Portugal), Ozora (Hungary), LostTheory (Croatia), Universo Parallelo (Brazil), Ozora(Hungary) Freqs Of Nature (Germany), Ozora Brazil, SoulVision (Brazil), Origin (South Africa), Klika Of Happiness(Israel), Park.Art Progressive (Brazil), Adana (Brazil), EarthFrequency (Aus), Psyfari (Aus), Lucid Labrythnth (Aus),Yemaya (Aus), Fractangular (Aus), Earthcore (Aus)

events.id: Capital Blues Presents: BB and the Bullets-13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Capital Blues Presents: BB and the Bullets
events.venue: 13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
“An authentic, powerful and generous album, which will undoubtedly place BB & The Bullets among the blues rock revelations of the year.” – Zicazic Magazine, France
It’s been a great couple of weeks for dynamic Whanganui blues band BB & THE BULLETS! 
Currently playing their North Island tour, celebrating the international release of their debut album HIGH TIDE from September, the album has achieved impressive traction across Aotearoa’s music soundscape by entering the Official Top 20 Aotearoa Albums at #12 and #5 on the Independent Music NZ Charts!
Landing on both the IMNZ Charts and the Official Aotearoa Music Charts is a cracking result, not just as independent artists, but also for a blues-rock outfit, demonstrating that it’s a genre that can successfully cross both indie and conventional charts, appealing to both grassroots and mainstream audiences – an outcome that the band is thrilled about.
“It’s a great result! We are so proud to be #5 on the IMNZ Chart. Independent artists are the grassroots and lifeblood of Kiwi music. And there’s only been a few local indie blues-rock albums on the Official Aotearoa Music Charts over the last decade – our mate Grant Haua in 2022, and Troy Kingi in 2016, so we’re stoked to be here and rep the Blues in 2025!”
The tight, three piece blues rock outfit of band members Brad McMillan (drums), Stu Duncan (bass), and Brian Baker (guitar / vocals)  have garnered a reputation for their powerful and moving live performances, drawing comparisons to Stevie Ray Vaughan, Johnny Winter, Peter Green and Jeff Beck, while firmly putting their own stamp on the timeless medium that is the blues.
BB & The Bullets have released three well received singles to date off the album: debut single ‘Something In The Water’; album title track ‘High Tide’; and their blues-soaked rendition of the Beatles classic ‘I Want You (She’s So Heavy)’ which is a huge fan favourite at their live shows. To date, all three singles have enjoyed some excellent blues radio attention, including airplay on Radio New Zealand and around the country, as well as in Germany, USA, and Canada, with ‘High Tide’ charting at #4 on Roots Music Charts in Australia, achieving #1 on the Roots Music Report Blues Album Chart, #1 on the Blues Rock Album Chart and three songs on the Blues Singles chart.
Home country of their label Dixiefrog Records has plenty of great things to say about BB & The Bullets, with Paris Move Magazine giving the album a very favourable review, ranking it as a ‘red heart’ favourite, as has French outlet Zicazic Magazine, and the title track single ‘High Tide’ has made the weekly playlist of Rolling Stone Magazine, France.
“This album proves to be a declaration of love to the roots of the blues, driven by striking live energy and unabashed virtuosity.” – Zicazic Magazine, France
With a well-deserved reputation for their compelling live shows, BB & The Bullets audiences are always wowed by the power and intensity of their performances.
With this chart action, it is evident that the blues scene is alive and vibrant on Antipodean shores, grab your mates and don’t miss your chance to check out a blues-rock experience like no other with BB & The Bullets!

events.id: Sexy Ghost of Xmas Boy-BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Sexy Ghost of Xmas Boy
events.venue: BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington
events.long_description:
The silly season spin-off of the legendary Sexy Ghost Trilogy, creator George Fenn presents an unmissable Christmas performance to warm the hearts of Wellington's worn wretches to remind them of the true meaning of Christmas: Dystopic Consumerism.

This interactive experience combines elements of clown and burlesque to make an unmissable wordless comedy.

Tickets $30 waged / $20 unwaged.

“The Sexy Ghost of Xmas Boy has been unlike anything I have ever experienced and it has been so much fun! My stomach hurts from laughing non-stop for an hour along with every other person in the audience. Fenn has given us sexy, unhinged chaos and camaraderie, and has definitely warmed our cold winter hearts!” - Ayla Chamberlain, Theatreview

“A theatrical alchemist, Fenn has the rare talent to create something utterly ridiculous yet very clever.” - Rosheen FitzGerald, Theatreview

This event is strictly R18, it contains sexual themes and nudity down to underwear.

Professional Bull Riders presents PBR NZ . . . the toughest sport on dirt!

Making it's New Zealand debut this December at Manfeild Stadium in Feilding.

PBR NZ will feature bull riders competing to win the Tasman Cup. The PBR Tasman Cup is a high-stakes international bull riding showdown between Team Australia and Team New Zealand. Nau mai haere mai ki Te Kunenga ki Pūrehuroa.
Please join us on our Wellington campus, Pukeahu.

Our tour dates for Wellington Campus 2025 are March 21st, April 11th, May 16th, June 13th, July 4th, July 11th, August 15th, September 19th, October 3rd, October 10th, and November 21st and takes just over an hour and a half to 2 hours.

events.id: The Pantoloons: A Spell Before Christmas-Wairarapa Events Centre, Holloway St, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: The Pantoloons: A Spell Before Christmas
events.venue: Wairarapa Events Centre, Holloway St, Carterton
events.long_description:
Everything is running smoothly in Santa’s workshop this year — the toys are built, the reindeer are ready, the cookies are baked, and even the elves are behaving (for once!). But trouble is never far away…

Curious Buddy, the elf on a shelf, discovers a dusty old bottle marked “DO NOT OPEN.” Of course, he opens it and out bursts a magical spell that shatters into tiny sparkles, floating through the workshop and before long Freezle and Elfis are back to their naughty ways!

Can Santa, the Christmas Fairy, and the rest of the gang catch the spell before it causes too much chaos? Or will Christmas unravel quicker than Buddy can eat a gingerbread man?

Packed with laughter, songs, and festive magic, A Spell Before Christmas is an hilarious pantomime treat for the whole family and grab a photo with Santa and the elves after the show!

events.id: Wellington Speed Dating for ages 26- 44 by Cheeky Events Australia-The Arborist Rooftop Bar,166 Willis Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Wellington Speed Dating for ages 26- 44 by Cheeky Events Australia
events.venue: The Arborist Rooftop Bar,166 Willis Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington Speed Dating for ages 26- 44 by Cheeky Events Australia
Get ready for a night of fun and connection at Wellington's hottest speed dating event!

About this Event

Let’s ditch the apps together and embrace real connections. Say goodbye to the dating apps and hello to your very own Cheeky Love Story! 💖
🍸 What’s included: Your first drink is on us—let’s toast to great company!
👇How It Works:
Before the event:Make sure to download the Cheeky Events App (free on Google Play & the App Store) to set up your profile and upload a photo.
P.S. Don’t worry—it’s not a dating app! We’ve skipped the chat feature because we’re all about real, in-person connections.
During the event:
Check in to grab your name tag and free drink token. 🍻
Arrive on time to enjoy 15 minutes of casual pre-mingling.
Ladies stay seated while men rotate every 5 minutes—don’t forget to rate your matches in the app! 👍👎
Take a quick 15-minute break before the next round.
After the rotations, feel free to stick around for some extra socializing!
After the event: Stay for extra mingling and check the app for your cheeky matches 12 hours later! 📱💖
For more details, check out our blog: What to expect
Who knows? You might just find your next spark! ✨ Our IRL singles events (single mixers and speed dating events) are happening across Australia, New Zealand, London, and NYC! 🌏

About Cheeky Events
We host fun, inclusive singles events across Australia, New Zealand, London, and NYC! Whether you’re in your 20s, over 40, looking for love, or just looking to meet new people, our events are designed to bring people together. Whether you’re seeking romance, new friendships, or even networking, we’ve got something for everyone!
👉 Follow us on Instagram:@cheekyeventsaustralia @cheekyeventsukandireland @cheekyeventsnewzealand @cheekyeventsukandireland @cheekeventsus
Visit our website: www.cheekyevents.net or download the Cheeky Events app to get started.
We can’t wait to see you at one of our events soon! 🕺💃

events.id: Libbianski - EP Release Show @ Valhalla with Wince and Cold Ceiling-154 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Libbianski - EP Release Show @ Valhalla with Wince and Cold Ceiling
events.venue: 154 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Libbianski return for the end of 2025 to release their brand new EP - "Episode 1" along with some great bands across the motu.
LIBBIANSKI -
"Libbianski returns to the music screen as a thunderous 3-piece tightening their sound adding grungy, post metal influences whilst still keeping their ethereal shoegaze background. With their most recent single "CONTINUE THE SAD" released in late November, their next musical offering is "EPISODE 1", a raw DIY album recorded with Over The Hill Records that promises to deliver."
CONTINUE THE SAD:
https://open.spotify.com/track/5OMx2S9x92K5AsemN5BPqZ...
https://libbianski.bandcamp.com/track/continue-the-sad

WINCE -
"Wince - A showcase of absurdity, Wince strives to make you just a little bit uncomfortable with their disorientingly dissonant grind and groove"
COLD CEILING -
"Cold Ceiling is a three piece based in Auckland, offering their latest record I Must Be Closer to the NZ scene in April 2025. Their brand of blackened post metal is just what Kurt wanted for his birthday and by god is he going to get it?"
You can check out I MUST BE CLOSER here - https://open.spotify.com/album/2uBU0KuHiUP7A7ucahdTUd...

events.long_description:
Kai Tahi Kiwiana Christmas Market
🎄 Kai Tahi Kiwiana Christmas Market 🎄
Saturday, 20 December 2025 | 10am - 3pm

Get into the festive spirit with a day of Christmas shopping, local art & craft stalls, delicious kai, and family fun! 🎁✨

* Browse unique gifts at our artisan market
* Treat yourself to tasty food & drinks from Kai Tahi vendors
* Grab a cold one from Get Fixed Bicycle Cafe or Abandoned Brewery 🍻
* Join in the fun with giant games, Christmas decoration making, and a Santa Treasure Hunt 🎅
* Hang your Christmas wish on the Kai Tahi Wishing Tree 🌟
* Enjoy sweet holiday tunes from DJ Claus 🎶

It’s the perfect way to wrap up the year in a stunning setting with views over the Porirua Harbour. See you there for some festive cheer and local flair! 🎉

#KaiTahiChristmasMarket #KiwianaChristmas #Porirua #FamilyFun #LocalVibes

events.long_description:
North Pole Express Kapiti 2025
The North Pole Express is back in 2025!

SUBSCRIBER PRE-SALE 25 JUNE 2025
PUBLIC TICKET SALE FROM 1 SEPTEMBER 2025
Get your tickets or sign up for the “Nice List” at: ontrackevents.co.nz

Families love the magical train ride in one of the beautifully decorated carriages, you’ll meet Santa, sing, and celebrate this special time of year.

Set to the sounds of carols passengers are invited to join us to be whisked away on the North Pole Express and delight in the magic of Christmas as the train departs for a two hour long round-trip journey to see Santa!

COCOA CLASS – General Admission – $79 per passenger
CANDY CLASS – $91 per passenger

**Children under 2 and travelling on the knee of an adult are Free - please select "Under 2 years" at time of ticketing.

The Two Hour Round Trip includes: Entertainers, Carolling, Iced Cocoa & Cookies, Souvenir Mug, Santa Visit, Special Gift and Extra surprises on the way.

Also check out other Workshops in Paraparaumu.

events.name: VISIONING DAY RETREAT FOR WOMEN
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall
events.long_description:
VISIONING DAY RETREAT FOR WOMEN
Come and join Bryony from Heartsong Healing for a powerful Vision Board and Voice Empowerment experience as we move through the energy of the Celtic festival of the Summer Solstice!

This is a Women's Day Retreat.

This workshop includes powerfully transformative Voice and Energy practices which support manifestation of your dreams and visions.

New dreams, new possibilities and celebrations, all seen within the light and power of this powerful portal. Invoke the Source of healing, growth and positive change and new beginnings.

#vsionboard #creativity #healing #specialtimes #transformation

JOIN US FOR A DAY OF DEEP CREATIVE DIVING INTO OUR VISIONS - with specially chosen and composed healing songs, chants, conscious sound practices.

These are enjoyed alongside intuitive drawing, collage and fully guided vision board creation. All of this will be held within a sacred space of Spiritual connection, ritual and energy work.

We will make this sacred space in our lives to explore, clarify and strengthen our visions for our lives, for our selves, for our fullest and highest embodiment on this beautiful and precious Earth.

Saturday 20th December 2025 10am-4.30pm

This special day retreat will draw on the strong astrological energies available at this time, connect with our Spirit teams and Angelic forces and channel in the creative and opening force of Blessing, Balance and Alignment.

Through valuing what we are harvesting in our lives we make space for the next step, the new direction, the new possibility.

Supported by meditation and a guided practice we will each create a new image or personal vision board to focus us and assist us in drawing new energies into our lives as we move further into the new year. We will then use wonderful voice and extremely powerful energy practices, and healing songs, to strengthen and empower them and bring them closer to manifestation.

The day includes a powerful group Reiki healing session, Specialized Voice exercises, supporting materials and follow up resources and support. You will be nourished with a delicious, healthy, fully organic lunch and refreshments

Full day experience investment - $233 (limited number of concessionary places available).

BOOK HERE -
https://buy.stripe.com/eVa03P53w3cJboQ7tH

Contact Bryony at or call or text 02041010684 with any questions and for a no-obligation conversation

events.long_description:
See your favourite Christmas movie play out in concert. Featuring an all-star cast, Love Actually has become a beloved festive season film. A full symphony orchestra will play the soundtrack while the movie is projected on a big screen above.  
Join in the fun as stories of love and heartache unfold in one of the smash hits of the early 2000s. Come dressed in your favourite Christmas outfit and make Billy Mack proud. You’ll laugh, sing, and maybe even shed a tear as you experience the emotion of the ultimate romantic comedy.
*Film rating M for sexual references, nudity, and low-level coarse language.

Back by overwhelming demand, Love Actually in Concert returns to Wellington – and it’s as magical as ever.
