events.id: Banks Arcade // Wellington // NU - Zealand Tour // With Ocean Grove & No Life-San Fran,171 Cuba Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Banks Arcade // Wellington // NU - Zealand Tour // With Ocean Grove & No Life
events.venue: San Fran,171 Cuba Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Banks Arcade // Wellington // NU - Zealand Tour // With Ocean Grove & No Life
BANKS ARCADE ANNOUNCE TRIUMPHANT RETURN TO NEW ZEALAND FOR TWO EXPLOSIVE SHOWS

Auckland, New Zealand — 19th December 2025 — After a monumental few years sharing stages with global heavyweights including Highly Suspect, Northlane, and The Plot In You, and selling out headline shows across Australia and New Zealand, Banks Arcade have announced their highly anticipated return home this December. The genre-bending powerhouse will headline two unmissable nights on December 19 and December 20, marking a powerful homecoming to New Zealand stages.

Fans can expect an electrifying set packed with the band's fierce catalogue of anthems, showcasing the explosive live energy that has cemented them as one of the fastest-rising forces in heavy music.

Joining the lineup are Melbourne's genre-defying trailblazers Ocean Grove, whose wild live shows have earned them a reputation as one of Australia's most unpredictable acts. Also on board are No Life, New Zealand's rising heavy hitters, ready to set the tone with their unrelenting intensity.

Quote from the band

"Coming back to New Zealand to play these shows feels like a full-circle moment for us. This is where it all began, and we can't wait to bring the energy home and share the stage with some of our closest friends," says Banks Arcade.

🎟 Tickets are on sale now at www.banksarcade.com — get in quick, these will move fast.

Pick your own lavender - Summer at Lavender Abbey
20 & 21 December 2025 10am-3pm
Join us for a fragrant summer escape in the lavender field. Lavender Abbey invites you to pick your own lavender, relax with a picnic, and explore our on-site shop 'The Big Box of Lavender'.

What’s on Offer:
Entry only $5 per person
Pick your own lavender $5 bunch
Lots of lavender goodies in the onsite shop - all products made by hand on the farm
Bring your picnic - relax amongst the blooms with family, friends and well-behaved pups (on a leash please)
Easy access - off street and disabled parking available
EFTPOS on site - no need to bring cash
Whether you're chasing summer serenity, planning a dreamy picnic, or simply want to fill your home with the scent of sunshine and lavender, we’d love to welcome you.
351 Dalefield Road, Carterton - contact jan@lavenderabbey.co.nz 06 3797073 / 027 2759785

events.id: Rewa Rewa Station Craft Day-Rewa Rewa Station, 166 Rewa Rewa Road, Tinui, Masterton-Event Finder
events.name: Rewa Rewa Station Craft Day
events.venue: Rewa Rewa Station, 166 Rewa Rewa Road, Tinui, Masterton
events.description:
Our on farm Craft Open Days are aimed primarily at knitters, spinners, crocheters and other fibre crafters.
Romney, Corriedale cross Romney, Polwarth & Gotland sheep provide the fleeces to create fibre products for crafters which are sold via the Rewa Rewa Station website, and at Fibre Markets.
Our Craft Days give you an opportunity to work on your own project, seek advice, learn a new fibre skill or maybe just spend time with fellow fibre crafters while potentially ticking off a project or two in the process.
Please bring your knitting, crocheting, spinning , hand sewing, or any project you are working on and enjoy a drive in the country!
Everyone is welcome the more the merrier!

events.id: Social Sewing Saturday - December-Karori Arts & Crafts,7 Beauchamp Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Social Sewing Saturday - December
events.venue: Karori Arts & Crafts,7 Beauchamp Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Social Sewing Saturday - December
Come join us for a fun-filled day of sewing and socializing at Karori Arts & Crafts!

About this Event

Come join us for a fun-filled day of sewing and socializing at Karori Arts & Crafts! Whether you're a seasoned pro or just starting out, this event is perfect for anyone who loves to sew. Bring your latest project or start something new - either way, you'll have a blast chatting with fellow sewing enthusiasts. Bring your current project or get inspired by others' creations at our friendly gathering. Share tips, tricks, and stories while working on our projects together.
Don't forget to pack your sewing machine, fabric, and any other supplies you'll need. We can't wait to see what you create! You will need to bring your own machine and materials. Please bring an extension lead and multipoint box if you have one. (Don't worry, though—we have some in the centre, too!) We'll supply an iron and ironing board to share, as well as a table and relatively comfy chair each. There are also spare cutting-out tables at a taller height. You are welcome to come along and work on hand-sewing projects.
A kitchen is available on site and supermarkets as well as cafes are very close by.Parking is free and there are 3 dedicated spaces for the centre as well as others closeby.
Cost: Free for members of the Karori Arts Centre or $15 per person payable directly to KACC. (Membership of the centre is $105 annually and also gives you reductions on classes and access to other groups)
Please do NOT attend if you are sick (even just a little bit!)

events.name: Taste Kāpiti
events.venue: Otaihanga Road, 5036, NZ,115 Otaihanga Rd, Otaihanga, Paraparaumu 5036, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Taste Kāpiti
Celebrate your year with Taste!
A boutique beverage mini fest created to celebrate the unique flavours and producers of Aotearoa’s regions.

With successful events in Whanganui, Kāpiti, and now Tauranga, each Taste Festival is thoughtfully curated to bring together local producers, food trucks and live music in a beautiful outdoor setting.
Founded and run by event professionals with a passion for local culture and connection, Taste K`apiti is a high-quality food and drink experience in a vibrant and relaxed setting that doubles as a perfect end-of-year celebration for friends & families, teams & businesses.
Want to elevate your Taste experience? Check out our VIP/Corporate tickets/tables.
Includes:
A festive lunch, two signature cocktails, and access to our exclusive VIP area – complete with premium seating, shade, and great vibes.
Join us on the beautiful waterfront to eat well, drink local, and celebrate the best of the season!

You may also like the following events from Taste Whanganui:
This December, 6th December, 02:00 am, Taste Tauranga in Tauranga
This December, 13th December, 02:00 am, Taste Whanganui in Wanganui
Also check out other Festivals in Paraparaumu, Music events in Paraparaumu.

About this Event

Experience a day of top-class racing and summer celebration with five black-type races headlining the action. Gather your friends, colleagues, or club and enjoy a thrilling day at the track.
Feel the excitement as some of the country’s best horses, jockeys, and trainers descend on the Champagne Turf, all while you soak up the sunshine and lively trackside atmosphere. Whether you prefer a relaxed afternoon on the lawn or a premium hospitality package, there’s a perfect way to enjoy this unmissable raceday.

Exclusive Raceday Experiences:
Members Lounge Pass : $30pp
Desert Gold Restaurant : $85pp

Buy Tickets Here: https://membership.raceinc.co.nz/tickets/?id=20-12-2025#20-12-2025

events.id: North Pole Express Kapiti: 1pm - Saturday, 20 December 2025-Paraparaumu Train Station,Amohia St, Paraparaumu, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: North Pole Express Kapiti: 1pm - Saturday, 20 December 2025
events.venue: Paraparaumu Train Station,Amohia St, Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
North Pole Express Kapiti: 1pm - Saturday, 20 December 2025
Be whisked away on the North Pole Express to meet Santa, sing, and celebrate this special time of year.

About this Event


Public sales commence 1 September 2025.
Nice List presale: 12pm, 25 June 2025 - 5pm, 1 July 2025. Password required.
No tickets will be held during presale, any remaining tickets will be offered to the public from 12pm on 1 September 2025. To join the 'Nice List' visit the .
If you would like to purchase a private carriage for your group on this service, please email prior to 15 June 2025.



Join The Magical Journey to meet Santa!
Your tickets include:
Entertainers
Carolling
Iced cocoa
Cookies
Souvenir Mug
A special souvenir from Santa
Santa
Extra surprises along the way
Our Candy Class and Claus Class Guests travel in comfort and receive extra treats along the way.


Prepare to be surrounded by the magic and wonder of the Christmas season!
Families will love the magical train ride in one of our specially decorated carriages. You’ll meet Santa, sing, and celebrate this special time of year.
Set to the sounds of carols passengers are invited to join us to be whisked away on the North Pole Express. Delight in the magic of Christmas as the train departs for a journey to collect Santa who has been magically transported to an undisclosed location along the tracks.
From the distance the North Pole Express arrives then the train Conductors invite you and the other passengers to climb aboard shouting “All aboard!”.


All Aboard
During the first leg of the journey wide-eyed children of all ages are invited to engage with characters who are eager to hear what makes the Christmas season special to them.
You’ll meet the conductor, and join in the fun singing and dancing with your hosts and a few other characters who will appear in your carriage on the journey.
At the 'North Pole' Cocoa Class passengers enjoy their iced chocolate from their souvenir mug, and a delicious cookie served by our North Pole Express hosts. Candy and Claus Class passengers will be served aboard the train on the way to the North Pole.
Along the journey Santa appears in your carriage to present each passenger with their very own Christmas ornament. During the trip, characters in each carriage lead passengers in carolling and entertainment as the train makes its way back home.
Children UNDER 2 years (0-23 months) and travelling on the lap of an Adult are FREE. All Passengers 2 years old and over must hold a purchased ticket.

Please note: Seating in our Candy and Claus Classes is strictly limited. Candy and Claus Class Guests receive some extra surprises and treats along the way.
Seating in all carriages is arranged in a configuration of 4 seats as per normal train travel. NPE always endeavour to ensure those who book more than 4 seats are seated in close proximity to each other to ensure they can enjoy the experience together. Children under the age of 2 and travelling on the lap of an adult travel for free.
Wheelchair access: Due to the age and design of the carriages it is not possible to board whist seated in a wheelchair as the entrance is stairs and the doorways are very narrow. However we will be pleased to convey passengers of limited mobility whenever possible provided they can step onto the train from the platform, climbing a step and move to their reserved seats with the help of an able bodied carer. Our crew would assist guiding the passenger up the step onto the train and arrange for the storage of the wheelchair in the guards van. The wheelchair must be able to be folded up and cannot be used on the train. Please let us know when booking if you need wheelchair assistance.

Photo credit: John Bovis
events.description:
Join The Magical Journey to meet Santa!
Delight in the magic of Christmas as the train departs for a journey to collect Santa who has been magically transported to an undisclosed location along the tracks.
All Aboard During the first leg of the journey wide-eyed children of all ages are invited to engage with characters who are eager to hear what makes the Christmas season special to them.
Candy and Claus Class passengers will be served aboard the train on the way to the North Pole.
The wheelchair must be able to be folded up and cannot be used on the train.

events.id: Heritage roses and companion plants - Guided Walk-Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Heritage roses and companion plants - Guided Walk
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
What place did these plants have in our colonial history, and when were they introduced to our botanic gardens? Do these plants still have a place in our gardens today? Join us to explore their history and appreciate their beauty. This will be an easy one-hour walk.

Meet at the Seddon Memorial, Kinross Street entrance to the Bolton Street Cemetery for this 60-minute walk.

Cost: $5 (cash only, please). Or free for Friends.

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden; they run twice monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.

Join the Friends for only $30 a year, and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

events.id: Artisan Craft Market-Christmas on the Lawn-Riddiford Gardens, Laings Road, Lower Hutt, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Artisan Craft Market-Christmas on the Lawn
events.venue: Riddiford Gardens, Laings Road, Lower Hutt, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Artisan Craft Market has been asked to work together to supply craft stalls for the POP UP CAROLS event that is to be run in conjunction with Nick Tansleys pop up carols caravan, some food trucks and hutt city council.
A lovely grass space near the lower hutt library- anzac gardens in the lower grassed area to fill with amazing local creators. Come enjoy Woderful Christmas carols, and celebrate a festive atmosphere in Hutt City.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

events.name: Christmas Concert
events.venue: The Potter's House Christian Church, Level 1, 28 Warspite Avenue, Cannons Creek, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
Potters House Porirua Presents: The Merry Christmas Concert 2025

Free Entry | Live Music | Major Prize Draw | Family-Friendly Event

Potters House Porirua invites you to a powerful and uplifting Christmas Concert on Saturday, 20 December at 6:00 PM.
This is a community night filled with music, hope, and the true meaning of Christmas — open to all ages and completely free.

What to Expect
• Live Christmas music and carols
• Real stories of hope and personal transformation
• Family-friendly atmosphere
• Christmas photo booth
• Free entry for everyone

Major Door Prize

Every attendee receives an entry into the draw to win a brand-new Breville Duo-Temp Pro Coffee Machine (Valued at $599).
Additional spot prizes will also be given out throughout the night.

Event Details

Date: Saturday, 20 December
Time: 6:00 PM
Venue: Potters House Porirua
Address: 28 Warspite Avenue, Cannons Creek, Porirua

Why Attend?

This concert brings together live music, heartfelt stories, and a strong sense of community. It is an opportunity to celebrate the season, enjoy a memorable evening, and hear a message of hope and purpose.

More Information

Visit: poriruachurch.nz

events.id: Peanut Slab-Otaki RSA, 9 Raukawa Street, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Peanut Slab
events.venue: Otaki RSA, 9 Raukawa Street, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Peanut Slab is an electrifying five-piece band from Kuku Beach in the Horowhenua, ready to take the New Zealand music scene by storm. They deliver a captivating fusion of reggae, rock, pop, disco, and timeless classics, ensuring every performance is a high-energy celebration.
Renowned for their spot-on covers and infectious stage presence, we have a knack for keeping the dance floor alive and buzzing.

We have a large venue, but it still has a capacity limit. Be early to secure your ticket. We are keeping the cost down to $20 to enable as many of your members, locals and Peanut Slab supporters to attend as possible.

Some more info on Peanut Slab:
Over the past 5 years they have played at any event you can think of and feature regularly at Finns Gastro Bar in Taupo, where we will be hosting this upcoming New Years Eve to a full capacity crowd. They are well experienced in playing Weddings, Birthdays, Clubs, Functions, and Events, and have supported many community causes and fundraisers.

With a remarkable collective experience of over 100 years in the live music industry, they are not just a band; they are an musical experience, priding themselves on creating memorable moments and connecting with our audience through their passion for music.

We are proud to support them as artists and are excited that they will be joining us on 20th December.

Ngā mihi
Ōtaki Club and RSA

Note - If you’re looking for high-quality entertainment around, then look no further than Peanut Slab Music. Get in to secure them for your next function. Gary Hibbs
K26 Productions, 022 197 6827, K26productionsnz@gmail.com

events.id: Banks Arcade | NU Zealand Tour 2025-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Banks Arcade | NU Zealand Tour 2025
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
After a massive few years that have seen them support global heavyweights like Highly Suspect, Northlane, and The Plot in you as well as selling out headline shows across Australia and New Zealand, Banks Arcade are coming home this December for two unmissable nights.
 On December 19 and December 20, the genre-bending powerhouse will return to New Zealand stages, bringing their explosive live energy and fierce catalogue of anthems back to where it all began.
 Joining them are their good friends in Ocean Grove, known for their wild, genre-defying live shows, and rising heavy hitters No Life, setting the tone for a night of chaos. 
 Don't miss this chance to see one of the fastest-rising forces in NZ heavy music up close and personal.
 🎟 Tickets are on sale now — get in quick, these will move fast.


San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

events.id: White Christmas - a Cocktail Soirée-Level 1/60 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: White Christmas - a Cocktail Soirée
events.venue: Level 1/60 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Welcome to White Christmas. A festive night out - minus the clichés.
All the sparkle, candlelight, and Christmas magic - just better dressed.
We’re turning Whisky & Wood into a modern Christmas soirée dressed in white, cream, and crimson (with a touch of gold). Think curated cocktails, sharp fits, and that “last big night before the holidays” kind of energy.
Expect a room full of style, a soundtrack that starts perfect for catching up and ends on the dancefloor, and cocktails that taste as good as they look.
Whether you’re still in Welly or sneaking back for one more night out, this is your reason to celebrate the year - properly.
What to Expect
✨ DJs and live music - smooth early, party late
🍸 Curated festive cocktails & premium bites
📸 Photo moments (because you’ll look too good not to)
🎁 Tiered tickets for those who want more than the standard night out
Tickets
🎟 General Admission - $59 Early Bird / $69 Final
Entry, light festive bites, a welcome glass of bubbly, and entertainment all night.
💎 Premium Experience - $95 Early Bird / $109 Final
Everything in GA plus a 2-hour open bar (7:30-9:30PM; select RTDs, beers, wines + 2 festive cocktails), a reserved leaner or table, and a small take-home gift.
✨ A reserved leaner or table awaits - just tell us who you’re celebrating with when you book.
Dress Code
White and cream with hints of red or gold - refined, stylish, and photo-ready. A little sparkle never hurts.
Music
Early evening DJ set, live music 8:30-9:30PM, then the DJs take it up a notch.
⚠️ Responsible service applies - one drink per person at a time.
⚠️ Strictly an 18+ event.

events.id: Halcyon Drift - Album Release Party-Abandoned Taproom Petone,38 Fitzherbert Street, Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Halcyon Drift - Album Release Party
events.venue: Abandoned Taproom Petone,38 Fitzherbert Street, Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Halcyon Drift - Album Release Party
Come enjoy the release of Halcyon Drift's new album Fading Light!!

About this Event

Steve, Matt, Matthew, and Gregor from Halcyon Drift are thrilled to partner with The Abandoned Taproom in Petone to share our life's work with you, through our newly released album, Fading Light!!
Produced by our great friend and collaborator Craig Sengelow, the album features 12 of our favourite tracks, capturing the essence of everything we've poured into this journey.
We'll be performing the album in full, track by track, followed by a set of our best-loved songs from the rest. This is going to ROCK.
We're also excited to be joined by Jed Symonds our support act. A talented singer-guitarist who's been performing for six years, Jed’s music draws from his roots in country and expands into the gritty energy of 90s alternative and rock. He’s currently carving his path through live performances, and we’re stoked to have him open the night.
Let’s give Jed a warm welcome and show him your full support!
Note, there is an option to purchase on a vinyl copy of Fading Light when you purchase your ticket to the event.

events.id: PapaSon in Paekakariki-98 The Parade, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: PapaSon in Paekakariki
events.venue: 98 The Parade, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand
events.long_description:
For the first time in 10 years, father and son reunite on stage. PapaSon brings together Matiu and his talented, well-known musician son Nikau from Casual Healing, weaving generations of sound into one unforgettable night.
Expect deep grooves, soulful harmonies, and rhythms that move body and spirit. A celebration of aroha, whānau, and music that heals, this is a rare chance to witness their beats, voices, and wairua blend live under one roof.
📍 Paekākāriki Hall
🎶 Beats, grooves, harmonies & love for all present.
One night only – come be part of the story.

events.id: The Wellington Comedy Club with Ben Hurley and Friends-The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Wellington Comedy Club with Ben Hurley and Friends
events.venue: The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
The Wellington Comedy Club Christmas Special heads to the Fringe Bar, with guest MC Ben Hurley

Ben Hurley - As seen on The Project, Seven Sharp, and more
With a massive but hugely likeable stage presence, Hurley can win over even the toughest room. A sharp improvisational mind and well honed original material make Hurley a popular act with audiences and critics alike.

Featuring:

Cori Gonzalez-Macuer
7 Days regular and star of What We Do In The Shadows, Cori Gonzalez-Macuer has been performing his unique brand of self-deprecating observational and deadpan comedy since 2003.

Lesa Macleod-Whiting - 2025 Billy T Award nominee
Lesa is a Wellington-based writer, improviser and comedian. She has been a regular on the Wellington improv scene since 2016 and began doing stand-up in July 2020, going on to nab the Runner Up spot at the Wellington Raw Comedy Quest. She has a penchant for characters, accents and fast-paced silliness.

Kipling DC - 2026 Billy T Award nominee
Kipling is the self proclaimed ‘Big Dog’ of Wellington comedy. This jack russell with a microphone uses his quick wit and killer crowdwork to leave his audiences in stitches and constantly guessing about what’s coming next.

Mo Munn is a multi-award-winning stand-up comedian, improviser and writer based in Wellington, New Zealand.
A regular on the professional stand-up circuit in Pōneke, Mo has taken shows to the NZ International Comedy Festival, NZ Fringe Festival, NZ Improv Festival and Chicago iO Festival.

This event made possible with support from Pub Charities Ltd, and Wellington City Council

Helping raise funds for the 2026 Wellington Comedy season, including the Wellington Comedy Club Rainbow showcase, and the 2026 Wellington Raw Comedy Quest
events.description:
The Wellington Comedy Club Christmas Special heads to the Fringe Bar, with guest MC Ben Hurley Ben Hurley - As seen on The Project, Seven Sharp, and more With a massive but hugely likeable stage presence, Hurley can win over even the toughest room.
A sharp improvisational mind and well honed original material make Hurley a popular act with audiences and critics alike.
Lesa Macleod-Whiting - 2025 Billy T Award nominee Lesa is a Wellington-based writer, improviser and comedian.
She has been a regular on the Wellington improv scene since 2016 and began doing stand-up in July 2020, going on to nab the Runner Up spot at the Wellington Raw Comedy Quest.
She has a penchant for characters, accents and fast-paced silliness.

events.long_description:
Exclusive evening - Discover the Magic of Martinborough Nights!

Join us for an extraordinary evening of lavender picking and stargazing. Immerse yourself in the breathtaking night sky.
Our expert Astronomy Guides from 'Under the Stars' will lead you through the constellations, making the night sky come alive.

Watch the sun set over the lavender fields, pick your own bunch of lavender, and explore our charming lavender shop.

Please note: No pets and no smoking allowed.

In case of unfavorable stargazing conditions, we will contact you on the day to offer a refund or reschedule.

events.id: Aerial Arts Silks Practical, IN PERSON, Wellington, NZ-SWPT,10 Lydney Pl S, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua-All Events In
events.name: Aerial Arts Silks Practical, IN PERSON, Wellington, NZ
events.venue: SWPT,10 Lydney Pl S, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
Aerial Arts Silks Practical, IN PERSON, Wellington, NZ
Aerial Arts starts at the very beginning, teaching instructors everything they need to know about correct placement and technique so their students will have the building blocks to progress safely from one level to the next.

Aerial Arts Teacher Training and Certification courses provide extensive training in spotting and progression so the teachers feel confident, knowledgeable and inspired to teach Aerial Arts.

This course is offered in person and delivers the hands-on spotting and instruction of the syllabus from Primary to Level 6. For this course, you will be required to attend in person. Demonstrators will be provided by the host studio: you are welcome to bring a student of your own.

During the course you will:

-Learn to spot and teach the 7 levels of Aerial Arts syllabus; Primary - Level 6 including Strength, Technique, Balance, Drops / Slides, and Climbing

-Understand the teaching and spotting requirements of each level

-Learn how to safely teach and spot each skill in the syllabus

-Review anatomy and stability exercises to assist in the training of Aerial Arts

-Review safety and rigging tips for Aerial Arts

-Review how to maintain your apparatus

-Learn how to implement Aerial Arts lesson plans

Pre-requisites:

Teachers must have successfully completed Aerial Arts Silks Theory prior to attending this course.

Teachers must be a minimum of 16 years old to attend the course. Full certification will not be granted until the teacher turns 18.

Assuming successful completion of the exams, the teacher will be granted ‘Assistant Teacher’ status from age 16-17 and can teach classes with a certified teacher in the same room. Upon turning 18, full certification will automatically be granted.

Info + registration: https://www.acrobaticarts.com/training-courses/silks-practical-in-person/1801
events.description:
Aerial Arts Teacher Training and Certification courses provide extensive training in spotting and progression so the teachers feel confident, knowledgeable and inspired to teach Aerial Arts.
For this course, you will be required to attend in person.

During the course you will: -Learn to spot and teach the 7 levels of Aerial Arts syllabus; Primary - Level 6 including Strength, Technique, Balance, Drops / Slides, and Climbing -Understand the teaching and spotting requirements of each level -Learn how to safely teach and spot each skill in the syllabus -Review anatomy and stability exercises to assist in the training of Aerial Arts -Review safety and rigging tips for Aerial Arts -Review how to maintain your apparatus -Learn how to implement Aerial Arts lesson plans Pre-requisites: Teachers must have successfully completed Aerial Arts Silks Theory prior to attending this course.

events.id: WHAC Presents: Honest 10 on 21 December 2025-64 Freyberg St, Lyall Bay, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: WHAC Presents: Honest 10 on 21 December 2025
events.venue: 64 Freyberg St, Lyall Bay, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us at 8:30am on Sunday 21 December for the final edition of the Honest 10 for 2025, taking in Wellington's beautiful waterfront. The Honest 10 is the perfect chance to test your 5km or 10km fitness and maybe have a go at walking or running PB.
EVERYONE IS WELCOME NO MATTER WHAT YOUR LEVEL OF FITNESS. The is an optional 8:15am early start for those who think they might need more time (eg over 70 mins for 10k)
[Note: If there are gales force winds, it is likely we will cancel due to safety reasons. Check back on this FB page at 7am on the morning of the race if the wind is howling as well will post any cancellation by that time. If nothing is here, then the event is going ahead
]
Organised by WHAC, the Honest 10 provides a fast, fun and friendly environment. The race course has been officially measured and there will be pacers running 40min, 45min, 50min, 55min and 60min to help you run your best.
Cost: Just $10 for 10km, $5 for 5km!!
How to enter:
1. Pre-register by email (recommended) BEFORE 5PM on Saturday 20 December. Payment methods for pre-registrations include online bank transfer (an email with your reference will be sent back to you) or pay cash on the day.
Account Name: Wellington Harrier Athletic Club
Account Number: 12-3493-0058553-00
Use "H10 [your race number]" as your reference. Eg "H10 #23"
OR
2. Sign up on the day from 8am (cash only).
Photos are free of charge and posted online (on the WHAC website) alongside results after the race. https://whac.org.nz/wp/honest-10/
Where: At the Whale's Tail next to Freyberg Pool, Oriental Bay
When: Registration from 8am. Race starts at 8:30am Sunday morning. Let us know when you register, if you request an early 8.15am start, eg if you are walking the 10km or are likely to run slower than 70mins.
***Pre-registration details***
Email the following details to honest10@whac.org.nz BEFORE 5pm Saturday 20 December.
You will receive a confirmation email back with your race number. If you select 'N' for prepaid, just bring cash to the race with you. If you select 'Y' for prepaid, pay via WHAC's bank account details below.
- Name
- Age
- 5km or 10km
- M, F or D (unfortunately we are currently unable to give age-calculated results for the gender-diverse (D) category, as our source currently only provides age-calculated result data for M and F)
- Phone number
- Prepay Y or N
BANK ACCOUNT DETAILS If you select "Y" for Prepay when you register via email, transfer your $10 entry fee (or $5 for 5k) to
Account Name: Wellington Harrier Athletic Club
Account Number: 12-3493-0058553-00
using "H10 [your race number]" as your reference. Eg "H10 #23"
Looking forward to seeing you on Sunday 21 December

events.id: Titahi Bay Christmas Fair-Kura Street Park . Titahi Bay, New Zealand 5022,6 Kura St, Titahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua-All Events In
events.name: Titahi Bay Christmas Fair
events.venue: Kura Street Park . Titahi Bay, New Zealand 5022,6 Kura St, Titahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
Titahi Bay Christmas Fair
Welcome to the annual Titahi Bay Christmas Fair, join us on the 21st December at Kura Park, Titahi Bay from 10am to 3pm for a fun family day out just on Christmas.

Our gold coin gate fundraiser this year is Wellington Free Ambulance, look out for the buckets at the gates, please dig a little deep every dollar helps.

We have a great selection of children's entertainment rides and over 160 stallholders showcasing their quality artisan crafted goods.

Fair day is a good time top stock up on those sauces and condiments, crackers from our local artisan food stalls for the BBQ season or as gifts this Christmas.

Join us for brunch/lunch with over 30 foodies covering every corner of the globe to tempt those taste buds.

Friendly reminder to bring some cash as some stalls and foodies do not have eftpos and we are some distance to the nearest atm .

See you on the 21st December






Also check out other Nonprofit events in Porirua.

events.id: A Spell Before Christmas-Little Theatre, 2 Queens Dr, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: A Spell Before Christmas
events.venue: Little Theatre, 2 Queens Dr, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Everything is running smoothly in Santa’s workshop this year — the toys are built, the reindeer are ready, the cookies are baked, and even the elves are behaving (for once!). But trouble is never far away…
Curious Buddy, the elf on a shelf, discovers a dusty old bottle marked “DO NOT OPEN.” Of course, he opens it and out bursts a magical spell that shatters into tiny sparkles, floating through the workshop and before long Freezle and Elfis are back to their naughty ways!
Can Santa, the Christmas Fairy, and the rest of the gang catch the spell before it causes too much chaos? Or will Christmas unravel quicker than Buddy can eat a gingerbread man?
Packed with laughter, songs, and festive magic, A Spell Before Christmas is a hilarious pantomime treat for the whole family and grab a photo with Santa and the elves after the show!

events.id: Christmas Carols 2025 - Back At Brewtown!-Brewtown, 27 Blenheim St, Upper Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Christmas Carols 2025 - Back At Brewtown!
events.venue: Brewtown, 27 Blenheim St, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
Due to massive demand we're excited to announce that Christmas Carols are BACK AT BREWTOWN!

We missed you all so much last year that we couldn't go another without bringing you the best Christmas Carols experience in Upper Hutt!

So get ready to rock out with Nick Tansley and his Christmas Caravan…and there may even be a visit from the big guy in the red suit himself.

We've teamed up with the excellent folk at Alliance Fire & Security and Empire Roofing Ltd & Construction to be able to make this FREE to attend! How is awesome is that!

Gather the crew, the Carols are fun for the whole Whanau - gates open at 1pm, show kicks off at 2pm.

Deck chairs are all good.
No picnic blankets please (to make sure there is plenty of space for everyone!)
No outside food and drinks (except water bottles) we'll have plenty of local foodies for you to enjoy and the Brewtown Bar pouring a refreshing range of beverages.

Check out the work of our partners

Roofing Company Upper Hutt, Wellington - Empire Roofing - https://empireroofing.nz/

Alliance – Fire and Security - https://www.alliancefs.co.nz/

No tickets will be held during presale, any remaining tickets will be offered to the public from 12pm on 1 September 2025. To join the 'Nice List' visit the .
If you would like to purchase a private carriage for your group on this service, please email prior to 15 June 2025.



Join The Magical Journey to meet Santa!
Your tickets include:
Entertainers
Carolling
Iced cocoa
Cookies
Souvenir Mug
A special souvenir from Santa
Santa
Extra surprises along the way
Our Candy Class and Claus Class Guests travel in comfort and receive extra treats along the way.


Prepare to be surrounded by the magic and wonder of the Christmas season!
Families will love the magical train ride in one of our specially decorated carriages. You’ll meet Santa, sing, and celebrate this special time of year.
Set to the sounds of carols passengers are invited to join us to be whisked away on the North Pole Express. Delight in the magic of Christmas as the train departs for a journey to collect Santa who has been magically transported to an undisclosed location along the tracks.
From the distance the North Pole Express arrives then the train Conductors invite you and the other passengers to climb aboard shouting “All aboard!”.


All Aboard
During the first leg of the journey wide-eyed children of all ages are invited to engage with characters who are eager to hear what makes the Christmas season special to them.
You’ll meet the conductor, and join in the fun singing and dancing with your hosts and a few other characters who will appear in your carriage on the journey.
At the 'North Pole' Cocoa Class passengers enjoy their iced chocolate from their souvenir mug, and a delicious cookie served by our North Pole Express hosts. Candy and Claus Class passengers will be served aboard the train on the way to the North Pole.
Along the journey Santa appears in your carriage to present each passenger with their very own Christmas ornament. During the trip, characters in each carriage lead passengers in carolling and entertainment as the train makes its way back home.
Children UNDER 2 years (0-23 months) and travelling on the lap of an Adult are FREE. All Passengers 2 years old and over must hold a purchased ticket.

Please note: Seating in our Candy and Claus Classes is strictly limited. Candy and Claus Class Guests receive some extra surprises and treats along the way.
Seating in all carriages is arranged in a configuration of 4 seats as per normal train travel. NPE always endeavour to ensure those who book more than 4 seats are seated in close proximity to each other to ensure they can enjoy the experience together. Children under the age of 2 and travelling on the lap of an adult travel for free.
Wheelchair access: Due to the age and design of the carriages it is not possible to board whist seated in a wheelchair as the entrance is stairs and the doorways are very narrow. However we will be pleased to convey passengers of limited mobility whenever possible provided they can step onto the train from the platform, climbing a step and move to their reserved seats with the help of an able bodied carer. Our crew would assist guiding the passenger up the step onto the train and arrange for the storage of the wheelchair in the guards van. The wheelchair must be able to be folded up and cannot be used on the train. Please let us know when booking if you need wheelchair assistance.

Photo credit: John Bovis

Join The Magical Journey to meet Santa!
Delight in the magic of Christmas as the train departs for a journey to collect Santa who has been magically transported to an undisclosed location along the tracks.
All Aboard During the first leg of the journey wide-eyed children of all ages are invited to engage with characters who are eager to hear what makes the Christmas season special to them.
Candy and Claus Class passengers will be served aboard the train on the way to the North Pole.
The wheelchair must be able to be folded up and cannot be used on the train.

events.id: Frankenstein for The Circus Hub-29 Wigan Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Frankenstein for The Circus Hub
events.venue: 29 Wigan Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Hi Wellington Community,
We are the Wellington Circus Hub, a not-for-profit charity dedicated to preserving the art of circus here in Wellington. 
We unfortunately must leave our current space at Te Whaea. By attending our Frankenstein Fundraiser, you will help us secure the future of the circus in Wellington. We aim to preserve the skills, the equipment, and most importantly, the community, so that when the next opportunity arises, we are ready to rebuild stronger than before.
For many, The Circus Hub isn’t just a space – it’s a second home – a place to grow strength, confidence, creativity, and real connection. 
Thank you for your support, and every little bit counts.
About Frankenstein:
Come and watch Guillermo del Toro adapt Mary Shelley’s classic tale of Victor Frankenstein, with a brilliant but egotistical scientist who brings a creature to life in a monstrous experiment.
Movie Starts: 5:45, Suggested Arrival Time: 5:30.
For more information, visit:
https://www.circus.org.nz/ Or find us on Facebook ‘The Circus Hub’
And to donate further, we have a give a little page:
https://givealittle.co.nz/org/wellington-circus-trust

We unfortunately must leave our current space at Te Whaea.

events.id: Michelangelo — A Different View-Tākina Wellington Convention and Exhibition Centre-Wellington NZ
events.name: Michelangelo — A Different View
events.venue: Tākina Wellington Convention and Exhibition Centre
events.long_description:
There’s no need to look up to see true greatness. The intricate beauty of Michelangelo’s Sistine Chapel ceiling will be on full display at Tākina over summer. Michelangelo — A Different View invites you to experience the genius of the sixteenth-century artist from an entirely new perspective. You get to be above and up close. 
Under license from the Vatican Museums, this exhibition offers a complete and authentic reproduction of over 50 stunning works. This once-in-a-lifetime exhibition allows you to experience the colour and detail of multiple works from just two meters away.

events.id: A Spell Before Christmas-Southward Theatre, Otaihanga Rd, Otaihanga, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: A Spell Before Christmas
events.venue: Southward Theatre, Otaihanga Rd, Otaihanga, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Everything is running smoothly in Santa’s workshop this year — the toys are built, the reindeer are ready, the cookies are baked, and even the elves are behaving (for once!). But trouble is never far away…
Curious Buddy, the elf on a shelf, discovers a dusty old bottle marked “DO NOT OPEN.” Of course, he opens it and out bursts a magical spell that shatters into tiny sparkles, floating through the workshop and before long Freezle and Elfis are back to their naughty ways!
Can Santa, the Christmas Fairy, and the rest of the gang catch the spell before it causes too much chaos? Or will Christmas unravel quicker than Buddy can eat a gingerbread man?
Packed with laughter, songs, and festive magic, A Spell Before Christmas is a hilarious pantomime treat for the whole family and grab a photo with Santa and the elves after the show!

events.id: Telescope Mastery-Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Telescope Mastery
events.venue: Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton
events.long_description:
Our Telescope Course is back!

You already own a telescope, but...

If you already have a telescope and would like to learn more about how to use it, how to collimate it and any other maintenance they need, what type of eyepieces are the best to buy and any other equipment.

BRING YOUR TELESCOPE ALONG!
OR

You don't have a telescope, but...

would like to learn how to use one, don't fret! We have 14, and you can learn all about them.

Your instructor:
Sam, our resident astrophysicist.

Sam is skilled in explaining the intricacies of telescope operation and makes learning both accessible and engaging. Our course offers hands-on experience with our diverse collection of 14 telescopes, ranging from classic reflectors to sophisticated refractors and versatile catadioptrics.

Where: Star Safari Observatory - 10 minutes from Martinborough


There's no "but" after our course. You'll know exactly:

- Where to start?

- What to do?

- How to get the best out of your telescope?

- What must you consider if you wish to plunge into deep-sky astrophotography?

You get:
A collimation cap - no more guesswork on how to collimate your telescope. With this tool, you can keep your telescope sharp.

Tea and coffee - refreshments.

Bring your lunch and a picnic blanket! We have a spectacular setting at Star Safari Observatory, and we will stop for a lunch break to enjoy our Moon garden and the surroundings.

Take the giant leap; reach for the stars!

At the end of the course, you'll learn all about the types of telescopes available and mounts, attachments, and eyepieces. We cover the whole lot. We have been using telescopes for a long time and now have an excellent range for our public sessions and at our home observatory.

We're not affiliated with retailers, so our advice is unbiased and based on our years of experience with lugging telescopes around the world, maintaining them and using them.
events.description:
If you already have a telescope and would like to learn more about how to use it, how to collimate it and any other maintenance they need, what type of eyepieces are the best to buy and any other equipment.
We have 14, and you can learn all about them.
Where: Star Safari Observatory - 10 minutes from Martinborough There's no "but" after our course.
We have a spectacular setting at Star Safari Observatory, and we will stop for a lunch break to enjoy our Moon garden and the surroundings.
At the end of the course, you'll learn all about the types of telescopes available and mounts, attachments, and eyepieces.

events.id: Hilarious Comedy Hypnosis Show in Wellington: Fun for All Ages-Lower Hutt Town Hall, 30c Laings Rd, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Hilarious Comedy Hypnosis Show in Wellington: Fun for All Ages
events.venue: Lower Hutt Town Hall, 30c Laings Rd, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
As seen on Seven Sharp (TVNZ) and going viral on TikTok, you’re in for a treat! Comedy Hypnotist Haiming Jiang is bringing his hit Comedy Hypnosis Show to your area. Get ready to laugh hysterically – and even join in, if you're up for it! It’s a night of unforgettable fun.

Haiming blends hypnosis and comedy to entertain the audience while showcasing the power and benefits of hypnosis through live audience participation. With his unique cultural background and deep understanding of both Western and Oriental cultures, this is a must-see event for anyone curious about hypnosis and keen for a good laugh.

Come and discover how this talented Chinese hypnotist uses hypnosis to both entertain crowds and deeply relax participants.

Experience the hilarious Comedy Hypnosis Show – where you could become the star of the night! (Only if you’re keen – no pressure!)

events.id: Christmas Buffet at Oak & Vine Wellington-Oak & Vine Restaurant Wellington,89 Courtenay Place, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Christmas Buffet at Oak & Vine Wellington
events.venue: Oak & Vine Restaurant Wellington,89 Courtenay Place, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Christmas Buffet at Oak & Vine Wellington
Christmas plans? We’ve got you covered. Join us for a festive buffet on Christmas Eve or Christmas Day at Oak & Vine Wellington.

About this Event


🎄 Christmas Eve Lunch & Christmas Day Dinner at Oak & Vine Wellington
Oysters, sizzling grills, glazed ham and festive desserts. Christmas tastes better when someone else does the cooking.
Join us for a relaxed celebration at Oak & Vine Wellington with a generous buffet and a two-hour drinks package including house wines, beer and soft drinks. Start with a glass of bubbly and a freshly shucked oyster, then explore live grill stations, a curated charcuterie spread, seasonal salads and indulgent mains. Save room for dessert — we’re serving pavlovas, chocolate fondue and Christmas pudding with brandy sauce.
Whether you're joining us for lunch on Christmas Eve or dinner on Christmas Day, expect good food, good company and zero washing up.
Event Details
📅 Christmas Eve Lunch: Wednesday 24 December 2025
🕒 12:30PM to 3PM
📅 Christmas Day Dinner: Thursday 25 December 2025
🕒 6PM to 8:30PM
💰 $169 per adult | $59 per child (ages 5–12)
Location
Oak & Vine Wellington, Oaks Wellington Hotel
89 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington, 6011
Questions?
Email our events team at





CHRISTMAS BUFFET MENU
Includes house wines, beer & soft drinks
Glass of bubbly with freshly shucked oyster with mignonette dressing & lemon on arrival

APPETIZERS
Cream of Mushroom Soup
Earthy and rich, made with sautéed mushrooms and finished with cream, garlic croutons.
Cheese & Charcuterie Station
A curated selection of aged cheeses, cured meats, olives, nuts, and dried fruits, served with artisan breads, crackers, chutneys, and honeycomb.

SALADS
Build-Your-Own Salad Station
Salad bar featuring two types of lettuce, assorted nuts, corn, chickpeas, cranberries, capsicums, cherry tomatoes, pickles, and a variety of dressings.
Apple, Walnut & Celery
Crunchy and refreshing, tossed in a light yogurt dressing with crisp apples, celery, and toasted walnuts.
Roasted Beet & Feta
Sweet roasted beets paired with arugula, walnuts, and creamy feta, finished with a balsamic glaze.
Pear & Blue Cheese
Juicy pears, candied pecans, and creamy blue cheese served over mixed greens for a festive flavour balance.
Kale & Pomegranate
Massaged kale leaves tossed with pomegranate seeds, pumpkin seeds, and a creamy tahini dressing.

MAINS
Live Grill Station
Free Range Chicken Breast, Prawns, Grass Fed Beef, Market Fish
Accompaniments: Red Wine Jus, Mushroom & green peppercorn sauce, Chimichurri
Carving Station
Glazed Ham
Slow-roasted ham glazed with cloves and brown sugar for a sweet and savory finish.
Butternut Squash Risotto
Creamy Arborio rice cooked with roasted butternut squash, parmesan, and a hint of nutmeg.
Sweet Potato & Lentil Bake
Layers of spiced lentils and mashed sweet potato, baked with a crunchy topping.
Sautéed Seasonal Asparagus with Balsamic
Tender asparagus spears lightly sautéed and drizzled with aged balsamic glaze.
Garlic & Herb Tossed Jersey Benne Potato
Baby Jersey Benne potatoes roasted and tossed with garlic, herbs, and olive oil.

Live Pasta Station (Kid friendly)
Freshly cooked pastas: Gnocchi, Penne, Spaghetti
Sauces: A classic Marinara, Alfredo, Herb Pesto
Condiments: Cherry tomatoes, capsicum, mushroom, sun dried tomatoes, capers

DESSERT
Christmas Pudding with Brandy Sauce
Traditional steamed pudding made with dried fruits and spices, served warm with rich brandy sauce.
Fruit Pavlovas
Individual meringue nests topped with whipped cream and a medley of fresh seasonal fruits.
Fruit Mince Pies
Buttery pastry filled with spiced dried fruits and citrus peel, baked until golden.
Hummingbird & White Chocolate Mousse
Silky smooth chocolate mousse served.
Seasonal Fresh Strawberries with Whipped Cream
Juicy strawberries served with lightly sweetened whipped cream.
Chocolate Fondue with Condiments
Warm melted chocolate served with marshmallows, seasonal fruits, and lady fingers for dipping.

Please inform our staff of any dietary requirements. Kindly note that the menu is subject to change based on market availability.

Cream of Mushroom Soup Earthy and rich, made with sautéed mushrooms and finished with cream, garlic croutons.

events.name: Christmas Dinner at Forage Kitchen + Bar
events.venue: Forage Kitchen + Bar, 345 The Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description:

Christmas Feast for Two – A Magical Dinner Experience

Celebrate the joy of Christmas with an intimate dining experience designed just for two. Le Ciel invites you to indulge in a festive evening filled with warmth, flavour, and sparkle — a beautiful way to share the season’s magic.

Each table for two will be adorned with candlelight, evergreen touches, and a hint of gold. Our specially curated five-course Christmas menu brings together the nostalgia of traditional holiday dishes and the elegance of modern cuisine. Expect luxurious flavours, handcrafted details, and a little surprise treat to take home.

Whether it’s a romantic evening, a celebration with a dear friend, or a thoughtful gift experience, this dinner promises to be one to remember.

Pricing: $120 per pair ($60 per person)

Bookings are essential — limited tables available each night.

TO START — Choose 1

MAINS — Choose 2 Proteins

events.id: Mehana at Meow -Echoes of Balkans-17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Mehana at Meow -Echoes of Balkans
events.venue: 17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Once again at Meow — let Balkan music lift your spirits!
From north to south, east to west, the music of the Balkans dances through landscapes as diverse as the region itself: playful melodies from eastern Serbia, heartfelt ballads from Dalmatia, expressive and ornamented tunes from the north, the unexpected eastern flavours of Bosnian music, and the vibrant fusion of influences woven into the traditions of Northern Macedonia and Greece.
And of course, we’ll add our own songs to the mix — An unforgettable night — not to be missed!

events.id: Roxy Retro | Monty Python and the Holy Grail-5 Park Rd, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Roxy Retro | Monty Python and the Holy Grail
events.venue: 5 Park Rd, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
50th Anniversary
A comedic send-up of the grim circumstances of the Middle Ages as told through the story of King Arthur and framed by a modern-day murder investigation. When the mythical king of the Britons leads his knights on a quest for the Holy Grail, they face a wide array of horrors, including a persistent Black Knight, a three-headed giant, a cadre of shrubbery-challenged knights, the perilous Castle Anthrax, a killer rabbit, a house of virgins, and a handful of rude Frenchmen.

events.id: Matiu-Somes Island Trip-Matiu / Somes Island,Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Matiu-Somes Island Trip
events.venue: Matiu / Somes Island,Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Matiu-Somes Island Trip
Join our club trip across to Matiu-Somes Island. Enjoy a pot luck lunch with time to explore the island before conducting an underwater clean up dive by the wharf (conditions permitting).

After a BBQ dinner it is time for a walk before dessert to observe the Little Blue Penguins returning to their nests at sunset and to hunt for Giant Weta and Tuatara.

Sunday morning is a great time to relax, continue exploring the island before the boats arrive and to conduct a beach clean up before catching a ferry home.

This is a great experience for the whole family.

$100pp + Ferry

events.name: Martinborough Lavender Picking
events.venue: Ranui Essentials, 284c Dry River Road, Martinborough
events.long_description:
Experience the Magic of Martinborough’s Lavender & Sunflower Picking Days!

Step into a sea of color and fragrance at our special Lavender and Sunflower Picking Days!

For just $10 per adult (kids come FREE!), you’ll wander through vibrant fields, hand-pick your own fresh bouquet, and soak up breathtaking views of the South Wairarapa countryside.

What’s Included:
- A beautiful bunch of hand-picked flowers to take home
- Free entry for children—bring the whole family!
- Access to our scenic farm for a full day of relaxation and fun

Make it a Day to Remember:
- Pack a picnic and unwind among the blooms
- Treat yourself to our NEW lavender ice cream and soothing lavender lattes
- Enjoy a peaceful, pet-free, and smoke-free environment

Don’t miss this unique opportunity to create lasting memories surrounded by nature’s beauty. Gather your friends and family, and let the lavender fields work their magic!

events.name: Martinborough Lavender Star Gazing
events.venue: Ranui Essentials, 284c Dry River Road, Martinborough
events.long_description:
Enchanting Lavender Picking & Stargazing with 'Under the Stars'

Discover the Magic of Martinborough Nights!

Join us for an extraordinary evening of lavender picking and stargazing. Bring your telescope, torch, blankets, and an evening picnic to immerse yourself in the breathtaking night sky.
Our expert Astronomy Guides from 'Under the Stars' will lead you through the constellations, making the night sky come alive.

Watch the sun set over the lavender fields, pick your own bunch of lavender, and explore our charming lavender shop. Indulge in delightful lavender treats that will tantalize your taste buds.

Limited tickets available – only 200 per night!

Entry: $25 per Adult (includes stargazing and a bunch of lavender). Kids enter free!

Please note: No pets and no smoking allowed.

In case of unfavorable stargazing conditions, we will contact you on the day to offer a refund or reschedule.

events.id: Monthly Life Drawing-Te Pūkenga Whakaata The New Zealand Portrait , Shed 11, 60 Lady Elizabeth Lane, Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Monthly Life Drawing
events.venue: Te Pūkenga Whakaata The New Zealand Portrait , Shed 11, 60 Lady Elizabeth Lane, Queens Wharf, Wellington
events.long_description:
Come along and have a go at portraiture with our koha life drawing sessions, hosted monthly at the Gallery.

With a mix of timed short and long poses, you are invited to bring your own materials or use the basic supplies we provide.

The sessions run from 2 pm to 4 pm—please arrive early to set up. We'll take a short kaputī break halfway through. This is a koha event, with all contributions going directly to our models. Friends and whānau are welcome!

Interested in modeling? Contact us—we're always looking for sitters. Everyone is welcome to join!

Accessibility Information: The New Zealand Portrait Gallery is an accessible venue, all on one level. There is an accessible wharepaku at the back of the venue. The gallery has automatic sliding doors and glass doors that can be pushed or pulled to enter. We have a wheelchair available for use within the gallery, and there is low stool seating throughout. If you have any questions regarding accessibility or if there is something we could do to make your visit easier, please get in touch.

events.id: Seaside Sloths NYE at Long Beach Tavern-40 Tutere Street, New Zealand 5036,40 Tutere St, Waikanae Beach, Waikanae 5036, New Zealand, Waikanae-All Events In
events.name: Seaside Sloths NYE at Long Beach Tavern
events.venue: 40 Tutere Street, New Zealand 5036,40 Tutere St, Waikanae Beach, Waikanae 5036, New Zealand, Waikanae
events.long_description:
Seaside Sloths NYE at Long Beach Tavern
Another year has somehow vanished quicker than a jandal in the surf… which is ironic, because if anyone has been preaching “slow down, bro” since day one, it’s Seaside Sloths. But here we are again — 365 days gone in the blink of a sluggish, slightly confused eye.

To mark the occasion, the Sloths are dragging their sandy selves out of the dunes and onto Long Beach — a venue so appropriately named it almost feels like destiny. Some say this is the natural habitat of a Seaside Sloth. Others claim the Sloths only appear when the tides, moon cycles and bar tabs align. All we know is they’re preparing a sonic experience large enough to usher in the new year, and weird enough to make you question if time really is real.

Expect bass that rolls in like a slow swell, guitar licks warmer than a Kāpiti sunset, and grooves that may cause involuntary swaying — possibly from dancing, possibly from the humidity, possibly from an existential moment about how fast 2025 disappeared.

So bring your mates, your jandals, your best “I’m not ready for another year but here we go” attitude — and join us on the Long Beach shoreline as we ring in a new year the only way we know how!

events.long_description:
Wellingtons biggest New Years Eve party is back at Brewtown.
Celebrate Brew Years Eve with the ultimate party night of legendary Kiwi anthems, wall to wall bangers and classic 80s hits on a night where the dancefloor never stops.

A New Years Eve celebration like no other, back by popular demand Dragon and The Jordan Luck Band, joined by The Automatic 80s & The Blueprint smashing out all the big party tunes you know & love.

The Soundtrack to Your Night
Our epic lineup will take you back in time with all your classic favourites:
Dragon — get ready for timeless anthems like April Sun in Cuba and Rain.
The Jordan Luck Band — Kiwi sing-alongs like Why Does Love Do This to Me and Victoria.
The Automatic 80s — taking you back with the biggest 80s dancefloor hits.
The Blueprint — Wellington's best rock covers band taking you through to midnight.

Say goodbye to 2025 with a bang — party with us as we transform Brewtown's covered Greenspace into a full-blown New Year’s Eve Party, packed with live music, massive party vibes, and all the magic to make your countdown unforgettable.

Wednesday 31st December
Brewtown, Upper Hutt
R18

Tickets:
$65 Early Bird tickets on September 9th (one day only). - Register now for exclusive access!
General Admission on sale September 10th.

This isn’t just another night out — it’s Wellington’s biggest party of the year!

So round up your crew, grab your tickets, and get ready for confetti blasts, big sing-alongs, and festival-scale fun as we count down to midnight together.

events.id: Courtenay Carnival - The Biggest Dress Up Party in the Universe-Courtenay Place, Tennyson Street, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Courtenay Carnival - The Biggest Dress Up Party in the Universe
events.venue: Courtenay Place, Tennyson Street, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Wellington’s most electric street celebration is back! The Courtenay Carnival transforms Courtenay Place into a dazzling hub of music, food, dance, and community spirit. From day to night, experience an unforgettable fusion of live performances, street eats, parades, and cultural showcases—all in the heart of the capital’s entertainment district.
What to Expect
Live Stages & Street Performers – From DJs to drumlines, salsa to soul, and everything in between, Courtenay Place bursts with energy. Expect a vibrant mix of circus performers, roaming comedy acts, drag artistry, and pop-up surprises throughout the precinct.
Entertainment Lineup
• Kids Disco – A fun, high-energy dance zone for tamariki.
• Circus & Comedy Acts – Jugglers, acrobats, and comedians bringing laughter and spectacle.
• Drag Performances – Bold, colourful, and high-impact performances lighting up the street.
• Wellington Batucada – The iconic Brazilian drum ensemble leading parades and igniting the crowd.
• Startime Band – Feel-good party classics to get everyone dancing.
• Love Shack – A crowd favourite delivering big vibes and nostalgic bangers.
• Saxy Time – Bringing funky grooves and late-night energy to keep the party pumping.
Food, Flavour & Street Eats – Local venues spill out onto the street with special menus, pop-up tastings, and signature Wellington flavours. From quick bites to sit-down favourites, there’s something for everyone.
Parades & Cultural Showcases – Experience vibrant cultural performances, community groups, dancers, and musicians celebrating the diversity of Pōneke.
Family-Friendly Zones – With entertainment for all ages, Courtenay Carnival is designed to keep families engaged from day to night.

events.id: New Year's Eve Set Menu at Hippo-Hippopotamus Restaurant and Bar, Level 3, 90 Cable Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: New Year's Eve Set Menu at Hippo
events.venue: Hippopotamus Restaurant and Bar, Level 3, 90 Cable Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Hippo’s turning the New Year’s Eve celebration up a notch. We’re ready to toast the year that was (and is) the only way we know how — with a little harbour sparkle, a lot of flavour, and a healthy dose of Hippo charm.

Join us for a three-course set menu by Chef Antoine featuring your choice of one of three dishes per course. Each plate blends classic French technique with the best of New Zealand’s produce.

Kick things off with Champagne on arrival, dance to the beat of live music, and the kind of flavour that keeps the night flowing.

It’s time to celebrate new beginnings, old friends, new friends and the magic of being back together — the Hippo way.

Tickets are $119 per adult for a 1.5-hour session from 5:30pm – 9:30pm (last sitting), open until late.

Seats are limited. Book your spot and bring in the New Year with a little extra flair.

events.id: Grand New Year's Dinner Dance-Tirohana Estate Vineyard, 42 Puruatanga Rd, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Grand New Year's Dinner Dance
events.venue: Tirohana Estate Vineyard, 42 Puruatanga Rd, Martinborough
events.long_description:
This traditional Tirohana event is back by popular demand.

Held in the elegant Grand Marquee with its French doors, clear window walls, sparkling lit ceiling and Italian fountain courtyard, guests will enjoy a seven course meal (dietary requirements catered for) accompanied by live music from the Neemia family, featuring New Zealand favourite, Drew Ne'emia.

The procession of the haggis is a highlight of the night, as is counting down to midnight and Auld Land Syne with party poppers and noise makers. Dance between courses or make new friends if you would like to share a table with others, or enjoy your own company with your favourite person or friends/family group.

Suitable for couples as well as small or large groups, this event sells out well in advance so please secure your table now and bring in 2026 with the Tirohana team.

Transfers via the courtesy shuttle available from accommodation in Martinborough.

WELLINGTON NEW YEAR’S EVE 2026 BAR CRAWL | Wellington NYE 2026 Event
Don't Miss Wellington's Biggest Club Crawl of The Year, New Year's Eve 2026 on Wednesday, December 31st @ 4 Premium Clubs

About this Event


🎉✨ WELLINGTON NEW YEAR'S EVE 2026 CLUB CRAWL ✨🎉
Ring in the New Year at Wellington’s Biggest and Hottest NYE Club Crawl! Celebrate New Year’s Eve 2026 with exclusive access to 4 top venues on Wednesday, December 31st, 2025!
This upscale, high-energy club crawl takes you through Wellington’s premier nightlife destinations — all just steps apart. Experience the city’s vibrant party scene, hop between top venues, and celebrate the countdown in style at the final stop as you welcome 2026 in unforgettable fashion!
🎶 Enjoy Top-40, Hip-Hop, R&B, and Live Music
📍 Crawl Stops: TBA — Full lineup of venues to be announced soon!
🕙 Doors Open at 7:00 PM at the first check-in location (TBA)
🎟 Tickets start at $30 Early Bird – grab yours now before early bird prices are gone!





What’s Included in Your Ticket:
🎊 Join Hundreds of NYE Revelers
🚫 No Cover for All Participating Clubs
🎆 Exclusive NYE 2026 Wristband for Club Crawl Access
📱 NYE Crawl Map for Easy Navigation 🗺️
🎵 Live DJs Spinning Wellington’s Hottest Tracks
🥂 Celebration and Countdown to 2026 at the Final Venue


🚨 Get Tickets NOW Before Prices Increase! 🚨
⭐ Voted Wellington’s #1 New Year’s Eve Club Crawl 3 Years Running! This isn’t just a night out — it’s the ultimate NYE experience where you and your crew kick off 2026 with unforgettable memories.
Meet new people, party across Wellington’s hottest clubs, and feel the electric energy that only a true downtown countdown can deliver.
🔥 Nonstop music, packed dance floors, and champagne at midnight — this is how Wellington celebrates! Don’t miss the city’s most anticipated NYE event. Grab your tickets, dress to impress, and let the countdown to 2026 begin!

🚫🍸🔑 Celebrate Responsibly!
We DO NOT condone drinking and driving. Use Uber, Lyft, get a Taxi, or a designated driver to ensure a safe ride home. Celebrate responsibly and make it a New Year to remember!
🎉 Let the WELLINGTON NYE 2026 CLUB CRAWL begin!


100% CANCELLATION REFUND GUARANTEE
👌 If the event is canceled for any reason, all tickets will be refunded in full! No vouchers, no credits, just your money back in your bank! Guaranteed!


WRISTBAND PICKUP INSTRUCTIONS & POLICY
Where and When to Pick Up Wristbands
📍 Check-In Venue: TBA
🕒 7:00 PM – 10:00 PM
Details: Please arrive at our first stop to scan your ticket and collect your wristband. You have from 7:00 PM to 10:00 PM to check in and pick up your wristband for the night. You can stay at this venue until 10:00 PM or explore other participating stops once announced.
OPTIONAL STOPS:
📍 TBA
🕒 8:00 PM – 10:00 PM
📍 TBA
🕒 8:00 PM – 10:00 PM
Details: These are optional stops — you can visit any of them at your leisure between 8:00 PM and 10:00 PM once they’re announced.
FINAL VENUES:
📍 TBA
🕒 10:00 PM – 2:00 AM
Details: This is the final stop! Everyone should meet here by 10:00 PM and stay for the massive NYE countdown party featuring live DJs, dancing, and a midnight champagne toast.
Please note: A Taxi/Uber/Lyft may be required for some stops. The crawl does not provide transportation or shuttle services between venues.
Wristband Policy
This is an open-format crawl. You must start at the first venue to collect your wristband. Once you have your wristband, you can visit any participating venues labeled as “Optional Venue” at your convenience between 8:00 PM and 10:00 PM or stay at the wristband venue. After 10:00 PM, all participants will meet at the final venue to celebrate and ring in the New Year together (marked as ‘The Final Stop’ below).
Please remember that you need to collect your wristband at the first stop, as it is required for entry into all venues except the first one. Also, wristbands are no longer available after 10:00pm at the first venue.


2025 CRAWL MAP AVAILABLE NOW:
TBA





TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated time at the scheduled venues before 10:00PM. Latecomers won’t be accommodated – no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can't make the check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband to ensure you don’t miss out.
Note Club Schedule: Each venues’s scheduled times are listed in the "DIGITAL BAR LIST." Wristbands (for entry) and any applicable drink specials apply only during these times.
Day-Of Check: Review the "DIGITAL CRAWL MAP" on the event morning for any last-minute details or venue changes.

Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you acknowledge that you are attending at your own risk. Events Per Se, its affiliates, venues, staff, and organizers are not liable for any injuries, accidents, death, loss, or damage that may occur during the event.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.

events.id: Time for Shenanigans on New Years Eve: CANCELLED-The Empire, 175 Jackson St, Petone, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Time for Shenanigans on New Years Eve: CANCELLED
events.venue: The Empire, 175 Jackson St, Petone, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Ring in the New Year at The Empire in Petone With The Shenanigans.

Watch Petone Light up with the Fun and laughter with the talented Band Shenanigans for an Unforgettable night of music, laughter, and dancing as Lower Hutt's biggest New Year's celebrations take over this Iconic Venue.
Be Sure to get in quick with Tickets only $25 it's sure to sell out fast.

From Live Music and A Dazzling Little Light show, this event will "to be sure" send you into next year with a smile.


So come and spend it with us.
Justin, Maurice, Paul And Tom.

And the Wonderful Crew at The Empire We plan to bring back a few of the Memories we all had of the Great Irish Bars we used to play in. Molly's, Kitty's, Murphy's law.

See ya soon Justin
"Tis our Luck to Know ya "

8.30 till 12.15 play time

Shenanigans are one of New Zealand's most accomplished and sought-after bands in Irish Traditional Music today. This young and exciting group creates a sound that is full of energy & innovation, whilst all the time remaining true to their traditional roots.

“Shenanigans was THE breakout band at the Gardens Magic in Wellington NZ".Their energy was infectious and the crowd response was incredible. They were able to connect to all ages, from Mohawked teenagers, to their grandparents. I had heard good things about them, but the musicianship, and stage presence playing live exceeded every expectation I had.” – Alan Thompson Director of Irish music Appreciation society 2013.

Shenanigans garnered much critical acclaim in recent years, even being compared to super groups such as by respected New Zealand Musician Magazine. Their meteoric rise in the music world was given a massive boost in 2011 when they were released their album Live 2005!. Shenanigans subsequently went on to receive the “Best live act on the Good Morning show” from well-respected Tv Presenter and were also named “Best Jokers” at The New Zealand Jokers Awards in 2012.

Following the tremendous success of their debut album “ballyscullymuckery”, the group’s profile was further raised with the release of their follow up title, “Live in your Lounge” in 2018.Nz Musician Magazine described it as having “so many good tracks, so much energy, a band in full control and having such fun yet well able to bring things down to a tearful pause”. Most recently Shenanigans was awarded “Top Band of few” by the a guy down the pub.


Shenanigans is one of New Zealand's hottest bands. Specializing in elegant live preformances, Shenanigans is the perfect choice for your event. Although based in Wellington, we perform regularly throughout the country; including Auckland, Christchurch, and Masterton. Shenanigans is a band seriously worth considering for the best possible wedding music that inspires non-stop dancing. In addition to weddings, we often play at charity events, corporate functions, catered affairs, and private parties. Shenanigans plays the best dance music ever written from the 1930's - present, which includes Irish Classics, Country, Rock-n-Roll, Ethnic, Group Participation, and much more. In addition, we keep our repertoire as cool as we can by constantly learning everyone's favourite songs. This hardworking Wellington wedding band spends a tremendous amount of time learning, reviewing, and ultimately perfecting the music required for each engagement. We play everything live without the artificial computerized support that most of our competitors rely on these days. You will notice that Shenanigans performs every song with a celtic fun twist. There is no better choice for wedding music.

events.id: Trentham Memorial parkrun New Years Day parkrun-Trentham Memorial Park, Holdsworth Avenue, Trentham, New Zealand 5018,43 Holdsworth Ave, Trentham, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand, Upper Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Trentham Memorial parkrun New Years Day parkrun
events.venue: Trentham Memorial Park, Holdsworth Avenue, Trentham, New Zealand 5018,43 Holdsworth Ave, Trentham, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
Trentham Memorial parkrun New Years Day parkrun
Is there a better way to start a New Year by clearing foggy heads from the night before than a 5km parkrun at the very start of the day?

We think not.

So come join us. Bring all the family. Bring all the friends. Bring all the visitors. Bring everyone. And start your day with a huge dose of endorphins and fresh air to help carry you through the next few hours before you fall back asleep.

And if you're not home for New Years, check out where else you could be doing a New Years Day parkrun in New Zealand
https://www.parkrun.co.nz/special-events/


Its almost certain there will be no Fig Tree Cafe post event breakfast as we're sure they'll be taking a well earned holiday to rest and recover before we start keeping them busy again in 2026. But please stayed tuned because we may be able to find somewhere else to feed us that is also nearby.

Don't have any plans for January 1st, 2026? At Waitangi parkrun, we got you covered! Join us to celebrate the arrival the new year! If New Year resolutions is your things or you just want catch up with your friends for a lovely jog/walk on the waterfront, then this event is definitely for you.

Bag your favourite volunteering role if running after celebrating too much the night before is NOT your thing. It's a short gap between January 1st and January 3rd (our next regular event), so we'll definitely need more help to pull this off. Please reach out to or ping us in DMs if you are available.

See you all there!

events.id: Friends of Karori Cemetery - Tragedies Tour (Jan 2026)-76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery - Tragedies Tour (Jan 2026)
events.venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Come and hear stories of those who met sad, shocking and untimely ends. This tour traverses some of the older parts of the story where historic headstones mark the stories of lives lost too soon: accidents, murder, misadventure and those who fell by their own hand.
This tour contains a number of adult themes and some graphic descriptions so is not suitable for everyone.
Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Please note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day 1 hour before the tour starts by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
This tour is approximately 2 hours long.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility.
There is only one toilet which is located by the cemetery office at the main entrance.
If you have purchased tickets for other people can you please pass our tour information on to them as well.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

With support and feedback from pastors and Bible teachers from around the country, we gather in small groups and give you tools to help you understand any part of the Bible and to teach it to others.
